loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Batsaikhan has used his previous loan for launching a block-making factory. This new business is now paying off and, day by day, his family's living standard is improving. Their daughters are attending institutions which provide good education. His wife is unemployed and stays at home, taking care of domestic work. 

Now, Batsaikhan is requesting a loan of MNT 4,000,000 to buy building materials, such as shingles, bricks, and fiberglass, in order to repair his roof and insulate his walls. This renovation is necessary since winter is coming and the previous year's renovation became old. 

After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to repair his house roof and insulate his walls for the upcoming winter.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 46 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Alejandra is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pay for her laborer.

Alejandra has been farming sugarcane for 14 years and also earns additional income from animal sales and a general store businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for her laborer.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda works hard to support her family. Emelda is married and has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines.

Emelda requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her business.

Emelda has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Emelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 41-year-old married woman with eight children, five of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gina has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 4 years.  In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

Juanita has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fish to sell for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like fruits, sugar, cube ice, etc for her food vending business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fruits, sugar, cube ice.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 54 years old, married, and has 10 children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gloria has a hollow block making business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years. 

Gloria requested a loan from NWTF for 21,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional cement, gravel, sand, etc.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional cement, gravel, sand, etc.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsetsegmaa used her previous loan for house renovation which truly helped her family to live in a warm place and saved money on coal. 

Her grocery store business is going well. As the number of customers increases, her goods are sold quickly and she is facing a constant shortage of goods. 

So she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy food stuffs in large amounts in order to meet the demands of her customers. This loan will help her business to expand and also improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs in large amounts in order to meet the demand of customers.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 38 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, sugar, soap, eggs and groceries.

Zenaida has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns income from raising cattle and farming coconut.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, sugar, soap, eggs and other groceries

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Eufemia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  Eufemia is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to  buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell at her general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Eufemia has been sustaining her business activities through 22 past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 37 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming flowering plants in the Philippines. Jessica is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seedlings, fertilizers and other materials.

Jessica has been farming flowering plants for 7 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
Haidee is 36 years old and married with three children. All of them are in school and Haidee works very hard to provide for them.

Haidee runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 32,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, cigarettes, coffee, etc.

Haidee has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future, Haidee would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, cigarettes, coffee.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 34 years old and has one child. 

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling native products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of native products to sell.

Arlene has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling native products for 5 years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Arlene aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of native products to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 61 years old, widowed, and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Gloria operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 30 years. She earns additional income from direct selling personal collection products.

Gloria requested her twenty third loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional items such as shampoo, canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, detergent soap, etc. to sell. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, detergent soap, etc.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and has one child who is in school.

Iluminada has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Iluminada has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

She has a restuarant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her restaurant business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Pablita

She earns a living by farming sugarcane and root crops in the Philippines. Pablita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and to pay her hired laborer.

Pablita has been farming sugarcane and root crops for 14 years. She earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay her hired laborer.

loans.name: Florita

Florita is 55 years old and married with seven children. One of her children is in school. Florita works very hard to provide for them.

Florita runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods and cigarettes.

Florita has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Florita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods and cigarettes.

loans.name: Helen

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Helen has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Helen aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Margarita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Margarita is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

She had successfully repaid her previous loan and now she requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jilma

texts.en:
Jilma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jilma is 62 years old and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

Jilma requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Jilma has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Jilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La papelería, los útiles escolares, las variedades femeninas y para el hogar, se constituyen en los artículos que vende Claudia en su negocio ubicado al sur de la ciudad donde habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 1 año y de 9 meses.  Ella tiene 35 años de edad  y 15 de experiencia comercial, pues fue apoyada por su tía quien le enseñó esta forma de generar ingresos y le proporcionó la experiencia de la cual hoy goza y que en el año 2011, capitalizara en un negocio propio, que ha crecido y con el cual tiene el gran sueño de hacerlo crecer, para mejorar sus ingresos y con ello su nivel de vida. Claudia está  aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual logrará responder a su mayor desafio, que el de lograr suficiente capital de trabajo para atender la demanda de la temporada de fin de año. Con este crédito comprará papelería navideña, detalles para el hogar, detalles femeninos y útiles estudiantiles, con lo cual responderá a su clientela en esta época de gran movimiento comercial en la cual necesita tener buenos inventarios para aprovechan el dinero circulante y poder ganar aún más. Su credikiva le dará mayor liquidez, mejorará sus utilidades, y por consiguiente beneficiará los ingresos familiares que traducen un mayor bienestar a su hogar y esto es justamente el éxito de la inversión.
texts.en:
Paper products, school supplies, and women's and household accessories are what Claudia sells in her business located in the south of the city where she lives with her husband and two children, ages 1 and 9 months.

She's 35 years old and has 15 years of experience as a merchant because she had the support of her aunt, who taught her this form of earning an income and gave her the experience she now enjoys.  In 2011, she helped her capitalize on her own business, which has grown.  It is her big dream to make it grow so she can improve her income and, with that, her standard of living.

Claudia's requesting a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which to be able to respond to her biggest challenge: having enough working capital to take care of the end-of-year demand.  With this loan she'll buy Christmas paper, household articles, women's accessories, and school supplies.

That way she'll respond to her customers in this busy commercial season during which she needs to have good inventory to make the most of the money in circulation and be able to earn even more.  Her Kiva loan will bring her greater liquidity and increase her profits.  As a result, it will benefit the family earnings and translate into greater well-being at home, which is precisely the success of the investment.

loans.use: to buy Christmas paper, household articles, women's accessories, and school supplies

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbat, 53 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. 

He has been working as a plasterer with a builder company since 2004. His wife is a cook and works in a small cafeteria. They have five children; three of whom are married and now live separately with their own families. 

Mr. Ganbat is requesting a loan of 1,700,000 MNT to buy new furniture such as a drawer and a sofa. By doing so, his family will live in a more comfortable condition that will provide good rest after everyday's hard work.

loans.use: to buy new furniture such as a drawer and a sofa, to improve his family's living condition

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jane is 36 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jane has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and carry out other maintenance for her business.

Jane has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and do other maintenance on her motorcycle.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Josephine is 37 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Josephine has a plastic bag-making business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 10,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc for her fishing business.

Isabelita has been in this business for 29 years. Isabelita earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

Isabelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, gasoline.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is 54 years old and married with six children. With four children currently in school, Nerissa works very hard to provide for them.

Nerissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Nerissa has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, noodles, coffee, milk, juice, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Nerissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:

Genalyn runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.  Genalyn has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Genalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Independencia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Independencia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Independencia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell in her business.

Independencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 60 years old and married with seven children.

Patricia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Patricia has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Patricia aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lowella

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, five of whom are in school, Lowella works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell eggs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Lowella is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional trays of eggs to sell for her buy-and-sell eggs business.

Lowella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional trays of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Harbie Apple

texts.en:
Harbie Apple is single and is working in the government service in order to make a living. She is still living with her family in Ozamiz City. 

To help them augment their situation, Harbie Apple gives her parents capital in order for them to make a business which is to buy and sell newly harvested palay and sell it in volume in town. She joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a new loan to purchase more rice in the husk for selling in addition to her stocks. Her parents are the ones managing the business. 

In this photo, Harbie Apple was taken in the office where she works and earns her salary. She wants to buy a truck to be used for their business in the future.

loans.use: buy rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en:
Medarda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy more materials like woods, nails, paints, etc. for her business.  Medarda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Medarda has been in this business for 6 years. She also earns more income from a general store.  Medarda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

Medarda dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy materials for her furniture business

loans.name: Thắng

texts.en:
Thắng is 33 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thắng works in agriculture farming food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thắng faces in her life is not having a biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a biogas system.

In 2012, Thắng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thắng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build the biogas system.

loans.name: Bốn

texts.en:
Mrs Bốn operates a food stall/restaurant, selling fish. Bốn  is 40 years old and she is married, with three children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with three dependents.

This is Bốn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in her business for more than ten years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Bốn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Hiền works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.

Hiền is 49 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hiền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Hiền faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Hiền hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 70 years old and widowed with six children. Leonarda works very hard to provide for them.

Leonarda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like detergent soap, canned goods, shampoo, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Leonarda has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, canned goods, shampoo, noodles, cooking oil, etc. 

In the future, Leonarda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leonida works hard to support her family.   She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

Leonida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Tarsisia

Tarsisia is 58 years old and married with five children.

Tarsisia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Tarsisia has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for thirty years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Tarsisia aspires to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Jonilyn

texts.en:
Jonilyn is 52 years old and married with eight children, two of her children are in school.  Jonilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jonilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like, shampoo, groceries, etc.  She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Jonilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Marcellana

Marcellana works hard to support her family. Marcellana is married and has a business selling softdrinks and beers in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Marcellana requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional cases of softdrinks and beers to sell to her customers.

Marcellana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy softdrinks and beer to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman with ten children, three of whom are in school.  She is 50 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Julia has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.  She has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Julia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александру 44 года. Он женат, у него 2 детей. Александр 20 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством в Большой Кардашинке. На 1.35 га в теплицах он выращивает ранние и поздние овощи: помидоры и огурцы. 
На сумму в 40 000 гривен Александр планирует построить новые металлические теплицы взамен изношенных деревянных. В перспективе хочет дальше заниматься этим бизнесом, расширять его, поэтому и вкладывает в его развитие и качество.
texts.en:
Alexander is 44 years old. He is married and has two daughters. Alexander has worked with greenhouse farming in Bolshaya Kardashinka for 20 years. He grows early and late vegetables in greenhouses of 1.35 hectares: Tomatoes and cucumbers. 

For the amount of 40,000 hryvnia, Alexander plans to build new metallic greenhouses instead of the old wooden ones. In the future, he would like to continue to work with this business and expand it, and this is why he invests in its development and quality.

loans.use: to construct metal greenhouses to replace his old wooden ones

loans.name: Tình

texts.en:
Tình is 56 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province, where he operates a food stall selling fruit, which he has been doing for more than 10 years.

Tình requested his first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women, which he will use to purchase sand, cement and brick to build toilet because he does not have money to repair the latrine. With his business profit, Tình hopes to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build toilet.

loans.name: Srikandi 1 Group

texts.en:
Srikandi 1 group members have received the fourth loans from MUK.  Ni Made is the new head and leads the 8 members wisely. After making the previous repayment, the last head of the group decided to resign because she must move to the city to work there. Any repayment of the new loan will be done on time under the supervision of Ni Made, the new head. 

Ni Made sold four pigs at a satisfactory price because it is close to the holiday. But when the time comes for receiving the loan, Ni Made couldn't attend the meeting because of illness. The process was reprensented by the Treasurer.

Ni Nyoman, as one member of the Srikandi 1 group, bought piglets for 1,400,000 IDR and feed 2,000,000 IDR for 6 months. Gross sales was 7,200,000 IDR and she earned a net profit 3,800,000 IDR.  Ni Nyoman is very grateful for the benefits she earned and she thanked lenders for the help. Ni Nyoman lives with her 2 children. For electricity and water, Ni Nyoman spends 200,000 IDR per month.

Ni Nyoman and all members of Srikandi 1 agreed to continue to have another loan. They still need a loan to develop their businesses raising pigs. They will stop borrowing when they have enough savings for their own capital.

With full support from her children, Ni Nyoman use the loan to buy 4 superior piglets for 500,000 IDR each.  The remainder of the loan is used to buy feed. By still keeping the pigs for fattening, Ni Nyoman hopes there will be an increase in profits. 

Ni Nyoman is in the front row with her hand raised.

loans.use: buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Uguljon

texts.ru: Угулчон жизнерадостная женщина. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ее муж строитель. Угулчон работает в государственном учреждении. Она всегда работала упорно и помогала мужу, чтобы дети получили хорошее образование. Ее сын Шарифхоча учится на 1 курсе Рязанского Государственного Медицинского Университета. Он является студентом Лечебного факультета. Она верит, что ее сын после окончания университета станет высококвалифицированным специалистом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Uguljon is a happy woman. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. Uguljon works at a public office. She always worked hard and helped her husband, so that her children would get a good education. 

Uguljon's son, Sharifhocha, is a first year student at the Ryazan State Medical University. He is a student at the medical faculty. Uguljon is certain that after finishing university, he will be a highly qualified graduate. 

She requests a loan in the amount of 2,500 US dollar to pay for his tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for her son's tuition

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара, 21 год, не замужем, детей нет. У Гулсары среднее образование, она спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Гулсара работает бухгалтером в компании, которая шьет одежду для новорожденных, и получает ежемесячную прибыль в размере около 13,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Гулсара в этом году хочет сделать ремонт в доме, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). На полученные средства она купит ДВП, обои и прочие строительные материалы. Получив кредит, Гулсара сможет сэкономить свою заработную плату и откложить ее на обучение, так как она хочет поступить в университет.
texts.en:
Gulsara is 21 years old, not married, and does not have children. Gulsara has secondary education. She is calm, balanced and hardworking. Gulsara works as an accountant at a company which makes clothing for newborns. Every month she gets an income of around 13,000 som (KGS).

This year, Gulsara would like to renovate her house. Therefore she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS). For this amount she will purchase fiberboard, wallpaper and other building materials. After having received the loan, Gulsara will be able to save her salary and invest it in education, as she would like to start university.

loans.use: to buy fiberboard, wallpaper and other materials to renovate her house

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 57 years old, married, and has five children, one of whom attends school. She works hard to provide for her family. Imelda operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from selling food.

Imelda requested her twenty fifth loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more items such as shampoo, bread, noodles and other groceries. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, bread, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey (in photo here) is 41 years old and lives in Muk Kampul district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has been married since 1992 and has one son and two daughters.

Srey has been a factory worker for two years, while her husband is a construction worker with three years of experience. She is applying for a loan to purchase materials for construction of a contractor's home. So, after the contract is finished she will get more money.

loans.use: to purchase materials for construction.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
To have additional income, Merlinda has been engaged in a dressmaking business within her community. 

She is 43 years old and blessed with four children. Three of them are still studying. Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband want to educate their children and give them a better living. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Merlinda aimed to improve her business to generate sufficient income. 

Having inadequate capital, she would like to ask for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy fabric, threads, garters, and accessories she needs for making and repairing dresses. 

She is hoping that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, garters, and accessories

location.town: Brgy. Almaguer North, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Having no other source of income, Girlie has been engaged in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables within the local community. She is 40 years old and a single mother. She aims to make her business viable and profitable in order to earn a higher income. 

Having insufficient capital, she would like a loan of PHP10,000 to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell in the local community. Having this financial assistance, she is hoping that she will further improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Conie

texts.en:
Conie is 75 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. Conie has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Darkangul

texts.ru: Даркангул 48 лет, замужем, 5 детей. У Даркангул среднее образование, она с 2010 года занимается торговлей продуктовыми товарами. Также имеется доход от животноводства и полеводства, у нее есть 3 коровы, 30 овец, 2 лошади и 8,26 ГА земли, где Даркангул выращивает ячмень и сено. Однако основной деятельностью Даркангул является именно торговля, она решила увеличить ассортимент в товарообороте. Поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товара для увеличения товарооборота в магазине. На сегодняшний день, ежемесячная прибыль составляет примерно 15,000 сомов (KGS). Доходы от кредита Даркангул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на расширение магазина.
texts.en:
Darkangul is 48 years old, married and has five children. Darkangul has secondary education. Since 2010 she has worked with selling food products. She also has an income from livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. She has three cows, 30 sheep, 2 horses and 8.26 hectares of land, on which she grows barley and hay. However, Darkangul's main business is the retail business. 

Darkangul decided to increase her assortment and turnover. Therefore she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase goods for increasing the turnover at her store. Currently the monthly income is around 15,000 som (KGS). 

Darkangul plans to invest the income in further developing her business, in order to save money for expanding the store.

loans.use: to buy consumer goods for selling in her shop in order to increase her product assortment and attract more clients

loans.name: Almas

texts.en:
Almas is a 26-year-old married woman. Her husband is a master who repairs utensils. They are raising two sons. Almas grows seasonal fruits in her lovely garden. She harvests apples and pears and then sells them at the local bazaar. She has been working in this area for 6 years and her monthly income is about 160AZN. 

Fruits are in high demand in Azerbaijan because they are very useful for health. People make jam, fruit pies and juice because fruits are tasty and sweet. Azerbaijan people like to eat jam with tea in the winter.

Almas’ garden is very beautiful because she takes care of all of her trees. She tries to use the best garden tools and fertilizers in order to keep her garden safe. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy new garden tools and quality fertilizers which will help her to grow trees properly and raise productivity.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools and quality fertilizers.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru:
Абдусалом 46-летний женатый мужчина. Он живет в районе Вахш вместе с женой и четырьмя сыновьями, которые еще учатся. Жена Абдусалома швея. Она на протяжении 10 лет предоставляет свои услуги по пошиву женских национальных платьев. Сам Абдусалом занимается купле-продажей рыбы. Эту деятельность он начал год назад и ему нравится этот бизнес. 
Абдусалом отзывчивый и добрый человек. Он хочет помочь своему племяннику оплатить за его учебу. Его племянник является студентом. Он учится во втором курсе Таджикского Технического Университета. Его годовой контракт за обучение составляет в долларах около 1000$, родители смогли накопить только чуть больше половины из этой суммы. Им еще не хватает 400 долларов, чтобы они могли оплатить полную сумму. Абдусалом видит трудное положение своих близких родственников, он не может держаться в стороне. Поэтому Абдусалом обратился за кредитом для того чтобы его племянник смог продолжить учебу в ВУЗе. Он надеется на отзывчивость и поддержку кредиторов Kiva и обещет выплачивать кредит в срок за счет своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Abdusalom is a 46 years old, married man. He lives in the Vakhsh region together with his wife and four sons, who still go to school. Abdusalom's wife is a seamstress. For a period of 10 years, she has provided her services of sewing women's national dresses. Abdusalom works with selling fish. He started this business a year ago, and he likes it very much.

Abdusalom is a responsible and good man. He would like to help his nephew pay for his tuition. His nephew is a second year student at the Tajik Technical University. His yearly tuition is around 1,000 US dollar. His parents were only able to save up a little more than half of this sum. They are still missing 400 US dollar in order to be able to pay the full sum. 

When Abdusalom saw the difficult situation of his close relatives, he was not able to stand idly by. Therefore he applied for a loan to enable his nephew to continue his university education. He hopes for responsiveness and support from the Kiva lenders and promises to repay the loan on time through his business.

loans.use: to pay his nephew's university tuition

loans.name: Piling Subur Group

texts.en:
The Piling Subur group made their payments. The meeting was attended by 5 members, the others member had a religious ceremony at the temple. During the meeting, they shared their experiences. They were able to manage the pigs well because they give them nutritious feed and vitamins. The Field Officer checks the pigs every month. They also make voluntary savings and give to the Field Officer to keep at MUK.

Ni Ketut has had a satisfactory result. Her pigs grow healthy and big. She sold them all to the big buyer. Now she has enough money to renovate her kitchen. She said many thanks to MUK, Kiva and Lenders to supporting her business. She plans to take another loan to increase her business.

To increase their population of pigs, the Piling Subur group decided to have another loan from MUK. This loan will be used to buy superior or local piglets, feed and also renovate the cages.

Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase superior piglets for fattening. The pigs will be kept for 6 months until they reach the maximum weight. Now the price for 1kg of pig is between 29,000 IDR and 31,000 IDR depending on the quality of the meat. Ni Ketut hopes this period she will earn enough profit. This time she will save all the profit. 

One member can’t attend the meeting because she just had a baby.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Rebejose

texts.en:
Being a responsible father, Rebejose aimed to improve his vegetable production business and earn sufficient income to sustain the necessities of his family. He is 60 years old and has five adult-age children. 

He wants to plant more kinds of vegetable for sale but he has limited capital. For this reason, he would like to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP12,000 to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and herbicides needed in vegetable production. He believes that this financial assistance will be a great help for him to improve his vegetable production business.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and herbicides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Tuyên

texts.en:
Tuyên is 51 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. 

Tuyên works in agriculture farming food. Tuyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tuyên faces in her life is not having a clean water system or a hygienic latrine. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick in order to build a toilet. This is Tuyên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

In the future, Tuyên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick in order to build a toilet.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is a responsible father who owns and manages a rice farming business within the rural community. He is 56 years old and has eight children. He wants to improve his farming business to have a plentiful harvest and to have sufficient income to sustain the necessities of his family. 

He wants to expand his rice plantation but he has inadequate capital. For this reason, he would like additional capital from KIVA lenders through ASKI amounting to PHP18,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed in rice farming. 

Jaime is hoping that he will get his requested amount to enable him to expand his farming business and increase his production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides he needs for rice farming.

loans.name: Mwanafaki

texts.en:
Mwanafaki is a married woman with children. Her greatest expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanafaki runs a business of rental houses. Her customers are mainly students and other people from upcountry. Her greatest challenge is seasonality. 

She is requesting  50,000 KES to purchase equipment for repairing and repainting the houses. She decided to join Yehu to be able to access the loan.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for repairing and repainting the houses.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Mariana works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Mariana is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, canned goods, snack foods, and school supplies for her general store business.

Mariana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, canned goods, snack foods, and school supplies.

loans.name: Eva Elisabeth

texts.es: Eva, tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su madre y un hermano en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz y frijoles con su familia. Ahora cuenta con su propio cultivo en el terreno de su casa donde realiza sus cultivos de maíz y frijoles para la venta. Esta actividad le genera ingresos y ayuda a su madre. Lleva tres ciclos de préstamo con la institución para mantener sus cultivos, el préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos, herbicida y fertilizar el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, también para el pago de trabajadores. Con esta inversión espera sacar mejor producción. Su plan a futuro es tecnificar bien su cultivo de granos básicos y sembrar otro tipo de cultivo.
texts.en:
Eva is 33 years old, single, and lives with her mother and a brother in a village in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. She has always worked cultivating maize and beans with her family. 

Now she relies on her own crops on her house's land where she cultivates maize and beans to sell. This work gives her an income and helps her mother.
She has gone through three loan cycles with the institution to maintain her crops. The loan that she is asking for is for 10,000 Lempiras ($475 USD) to buy compost and herbicide to fertilize her maize and bean crops, and also to pay her workers. 

With this investment, she hopes to achieve better production. Her future plan is to modernize her cultivation of basic grains and to plant other types of crops.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicide to fertilize her maize and bean crops, and also to pay her workers.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda is 35 years old. She lives in Ermera and she is a businesswoman. She is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more additional supplies with the loan including slippers, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, cooking oils, milk, aqua, sugar, salt, detergent, soft and hard drinks, candies and other things to sell. 

Right now she has a small kiosk in her house and she hopes that with this loan she can run a bigger store in the future. So for that reason she wants to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin. She opened her kiosk 2012 with her own working capital of $400. She is very happy with the loan that is offered by Tuba Rai Metin for her.

loans.use: to buy slippers, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, cooking oils, milk, aqua, sugar, salt, detergent, soft drinks and hard drinks, candies, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a hardworking woman. She is married and is bringing up 4 children. Madina is a sewer. She sews women's national dresses. She has been busy with this business for more than 7 years. 

She sews dresses with pleasure because she likes her job. She has a lot of new ideas and uses her new ideas in creating new fashions. She has regular clients. 

Madina is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy fabrics for increasing her income and working capital. She will use the profit from her business to improve the education of her children. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Kenjagul

texts.ru:
Кенчагул 54 года. Она занимается животноводством - ремеслом своих предков. На протяжении 8 лет Кенчагул разводит крупнорогатых скотин для продажи. От этой деятельности она получает прибыль, который едва хватает на расходы семьи. Ее муж по вынуждению работает трудовым мигрантом в России. Их семья ведет скромную жизнь в горном районе Хуросон.
Кенчагул является матерью пятерых детей. Она сейчас хотела бы увеличить поголовье своих скотин, чтобы получить больше прибыли от деятельности и улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Кенчагул нуждается в заемных средствах. Она собирается приобрести крупнорогатый скот и расширить деятельность. Поддержите ее.
texts.en:
Kenjagul is 54 years old. She works with livestock breeding, the profession of her ancestors. Kenjagul has bred cattle for selling for a period of 8 years. From this work she gets an income which is barely large enough to cover the family's expenses. Her husband works as a migrant worker in Russia out of necessity. Their family leads a modest life in the mountain area Khuroson. 

Kenjagul is the mother of five children. She would currently like to increase the number of cattle, in order to get a higher income from the business and improve the financial situation of the family. Kenjagul needs to borrow money for this. She decided to purchase cattle and expand her business. Please help her.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
Naima is a smart and hardworking woman. She is not married. Naima has been an industrious and clever girl since childhood. She began her own business dealing with animal husbandry some years ago. She feeds cows for some months and then sells them in a local market. Many of her customers are butchers. 

Little by little Naima is developing her business. She is going to increase her working capital and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy cattle for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James used the previous loan to buy a Canon digital camera.

He has been in the photography and retail business for the last seven years. He started this business so as to employ himself and be independent. He faces the hardship of limited capital as his business is seasonal but has hopes of constructing rentals to generate additional income. 

James is requesting a loan to buy bricks and iron sheets for his house.

loans.use: to buy bricks and iron sheets for his house.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy used the previous loan to buy pigs for rearing. 

She has a piggery project that she has been operating for the last 10 years. Her family dream is to own a large piggery project despite the challenges of price fluctuations and the high cost of feed. 

Teddy needs a loan to buy pigs for rearing and selling.

loans.use: to buy pigs for rearing and selling.

loans.name: Rozakan

texts.ru: Розакан успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам, помогшим ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Розакан есть 2 коровы, 2 теленка и 10 овец, на 0,5 ГА собственной земли она выращивает клевер. Также в доме есть маленький магазин, где Розакан торгует продуктами питания. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Розакан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы с теленком для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Розакан будет вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины. Она хочет  накопить средства на образование сына и постройку дома для него.
texts.en:
Rozakan successfully repaid her previous loan, after using it as intended. She is very thankful to Kiva and all investors, who helped her with financing. Currently Rozakan has two cows, two calves and 10 sheep. She grows clover on 0.5 hectares of land. She also has a small store at her home, where she sells food products. Her monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Rozakan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow with calf to increase the number of cattle. Rozakan will invest the income from the loan in further increasing the livestock headcount. She would like to save money for her son's education and building a house for him.

loans.use: to purchase cows with calf in order to increase the headcount of livestock

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla de 26 años de edad, esta soltera, vive junto a su madre, y reside en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Karla tiene su propio negocio hace 3 años de confección de ropa para damas y niños, confecciona vestidos, faldas, blusas, pantalones cortos, camisas, y también vende ropa en general. Ella decidió solicitar un préstamo para surtir de ropa como jeans, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niño para vender, Su idea es surtir el negocio de ropa, para generar otros ingresos y en un futuro piensa hacer un local solo para la venta de ropa y en lo personal mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Karla is 26 years old, single, and lives together with her mother in a village in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. For three years, Karla has had her own business making clothes for women and children. She makes dresses, skirts, blouses, shorts, shirts, and also sells clothing in general. 

She decided to ask for a loan to stock up on clothes such as jeans, shirts, blouses, and children's clothes to sell. Her idea is to stock the business with clothes to generate a higher income. In the future she hopes to have a store solely for selling clothes, and also to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to stock up on clothes such as jeans, shirts, blouses, and children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Гулнора талантливая и способная женщина из района Б.Гафурова города Худжанд. Она в возрасте 22-лет уже замужем, но детей еще не имеет. Муж Гулноры трудовой мигрант и работает в Российской Федерации. Сама Гулнора работает в ателье уже 2 года. Она предоставляет услуги портнихи и берет заказы на пошив национальной одежды. Сейчас Гулноре для продолжения деятельности необходимо закупить ткани для шитья. Из-за нехватки финансов она обратилась за кредитом. Гулнора надеется, что ей помогут и заранее благодарит за поддержку. 
Так как Гулнора целеустремленная, она в дальнейшем планирует расширить деятельность и брать к себе учениц для обучения их кройки и шитью.
texts.en:
Gulnora is a talented and capable woman from the city of Khujand in the B.Gafurov region. She is 22 years old and already married, but does not have children yet. Gulnora's husband is a migrant worker and he works in the Russian Federation. Gulnora works at a sewing studio for two years already. She provides a seamstress service and takes orders to sew national clothing. 

Currently Gulnora needs to purchase fabric to continue her sewing business. Due to a lack of finances she applied for a loan. Gulnora hopes that you will help her and thanks for the support in advance. As Gulnora is purposeful, she plans to expand her business in the future, and take in students to teach them cutting and sewing.

loans.use: to purchase necessary fabric for sewing

loans.name: Ariance

texts.en:
Ariance is a 47-year-old woman who is married to Kiranius, a 53-year-old man. They have 7 children whose ages are between 24 and 6 years old. Two of them are still attending college, and 2 more are attending junior high school and elementary school. Her husband earns income as a civil servant.  

Ariance generates additional profit from a kiosk and a poultry business she has been running for nearly a year. As her business developed, Ariance now has 2 chicken cages with the capacity of 600-700 chickens in each cage. Her kiosk business is also running well. 

Her daughter Maria is about to graduate and therefore she was required to finish her thesis writing. The thesis writing consumed much money for photocopies, printing, etc. Therefore, Ariance is applying for an Individual Loan from TLM amounting to IDR 7,500,000. The loan will be spent on her daughter’s education fees (thesis writing) and to purchase more stock of products for her kiosk.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's education fees and add more kiosk stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy traditional fabric and jewelry.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all go to school.  She supports additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on both a retail and a wholesale basis and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. She gets additional income from rental houses. 

Grace works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. In future she would like to build more rental houses. She resides in the family home where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph used the previous loan to buy fruits and bananas for selling.

He deals in selling fresh foods and farming for additional income. He is facing the challenges of customers who delay paying as well as price fluctuations. 

Joseph has a vision of making a big farm. He needs a loan to buy more fruits and bananas for selling.

loans.use: to buy fruits and bananas for selling.

loans.name: Maral

texts.ru: Марал успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, использовав средства по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. У семьи Марал улучшились жилищные условия, она купила дом и обустроила его, сейчас возводят забор. В хозяйстве Марал на сегодняшний день есть 1 лошадь и 4 овцы, также на земельном участке мерою 1,30 ГА, она выращивает ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). Марал повторно обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади с жеребенком. Доходы от кредита Марал планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, так как она хочет накопить средства на покупку юрты для возведения ее на пастбище во время выпаса скота.
texts.en:
Maral successfully repaid her previous loan, after having used the money as intended. She is very thankful to Kiva and all who helped her with the financing. Maral's family has improved their living conditions. She purchased a house and furnished it, now she is building a fence. Maral's farm currently has one horse and four sheep, and also a plot of land of 1.30 hectares. She grows barley for own use. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). 

Maral again turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase a horse with a foal. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business, as she would like to save money for purchasing a yurt (a nomad dwelling structure) and set it up at the pasture during the grazing.

loans.use: to purchase a horse with foal

loans.name: Maria Elvia

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 59 años de edad, esta soltera, vive junto a su hija menor en una aldea del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Doña María tiene su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, vende azúcar, arroz, frijoles, maíz, sal, café, condimentos, productos lácteos, jabón, pastillas de uso domestico, churros, dulces y otros abarrotes. anteriormente vendía ropa de manera ambulante y luego decidió mejor poner la pulpería en su casa. ha solicitado un préstamo por 11,000 lempiras con el cual va surtir y mantener mayor inventario de productos, comprara azúcar, arroz, pan, refrescos, churros, frijoles y otros abarrotes para la venta. Su plan es llevar un mejor control de sus ventas y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old and single. She lives with her youngest daughter in a village in the Quimistán district, Santa Bárbara. María has her own grocery business where she sells basic family goods such as sugar, rice, beans, corn, salt, coffee, condiments, dairy products, ham, tablets for domestic use, chips, candy, and other grocery items. 

Before, María sold clothes in a street stall, but decided it was preferable to set up a grocery in her house. She has requested a 11,000 Honduran lempira loan to stock her store and maintain a better inventory of products. She will buy sugar, rice, bread, soft drinks, chips, beans and other grocery items to sell. Her plan is to monitor her sales better and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, bread, soft drinks, chips, beans and other grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Tasian

texts.en:
Tasian lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 42 years old, married, and charged with the responsibility of taking care of seven children. Three of them attend school. 

Tasian hopes to develop and expand his business and also to pay school fees for his children. However, bad roads are still a big challenge to his business.

He will use the loan to buy more beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old Hassan lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with five children who all attend school. He operates a retail shop mainly selling general merchandise like plastic, sugar, salt and home utensils among other goods. 

Hassan hopes to develop and expand his business so as to pay school fees for his children. He will use the loan money to buy more sugar and salt to sell in his shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt for resale

loans.name: Mehrona

texts.en:
Mehrona is a student in her 1st year of courses at the Medical University. She is learning pharmacy. Mehrona is one of the best students. She is a very active girl, and she is single.

Her mother is a sewer and her father is a migrant in Russia. After classes, Mehrona helps her mother in their house. She needs your financial support now. Her parents are not able to pay for her education in the university, so Mehrona is asking for a loan of 1,600 USD to pay her tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay her tuition.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is forty years old and married, and she is charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children who all attend school. 

She runs a bar, mainly selling beer and soda, and she dreams of expanding her business so as to improve the general welfare of the people at home and also educate her children. 

She will use the loan to buy more beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 30 years old. She is married and has four children. She has been involved in business activities since 2011, when she started with her own working capital of $400. 

Now she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to add more items to her kiosk with this loan including water, candy, biscuits, sugar, cooking oil, slippers, soap, candles, salt, detergent, and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. 

She has a kiosk, so she took this loan to improve her business because she hopes to make her business bigger in the future.

loans.use: To buy water, candy, biscuits, sugar, cooking oils, slippers, soaps, candles, salt, detergent, and other things to sell Including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Leevi

texts.en:
Leevi is thirty-three years old and married with three children. 

Leevi deals in produce—mainly maize and beans—in Hoima, Uganda. He hopes to become a great supplier of maize and beans in the whole of Uganda. However, price fluctuations hinder the progress of his business. 

He will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Rosset

texts.en:
Rosset lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members.

She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her main challenge is high transportation costs.

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business so as to serve her customers better. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 49 years old and married with four children, three of whom attend school. 

Emmanuel started slowly dealing in produce, mainly buying and selling maize and beans. He dreams of expanding his business so as to improve his standard of living. He will use the loan funds to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a thirty-year-old woman who is married with four children and living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Mary sells timber in addition to owning a bar and a butchery to generate income for her family. She is faced with the challenges of price fluctuations and limited capital. Mary wants money to buy timber for selling. 

She is thankful to Kiva for the support they give to people. She has managed to start another income generating activity out of the profits she made in the previous loan. 

Mary has a dream of educating her children.

loans.use: to buy timber for selling.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius wants a loan to buy bags and textile clothes to sell. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He sells bags and textile clothes to the general public. He desires to educate his children to the university level. He started the business to care for the family's needs. His business is affected by inadequate capital which limits its expansion.

loans.use: to buy bags and textile clothes.

loans.name: Gace

texts.en:
Grace has got a textile shop where she makes clothes to sell. She lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda.

She also earns a salary so as to have income in addition to her business.

She dreams of educating her children but inadequate capital hinders her business. She wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: buy  clothes for sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 48 years old and married, with five children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlinda has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from a general store and food-vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mahadsharif

texts.en:
Mahadsharif was born in 1958. He is a careful father of eight children. His wife is a farmer. She grows agriculture products. Mahadsharif’s son, Muhammadshokir, is 23 years old. He is a student of the second course. He studies in Russia. Mahadsharif is proud of his son because he studies well. 

He must pay for the education of his son, but he does not have the money for it. He is asking for a loan of USD 2,350. He needs your financial support and awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is married with five children and all go to school.  She has additional family members. She operates a shop on both retail and wholesale basis, and sge has been in this business for 12 years. 

Zaina has applied for a loan of 2,100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cooking oil, beans, peas, cartons of salt, sugar, and rice and crates of sodas for sale.  She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and power shortages.  She would like to educate her children up to university level. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, beans, flour, cartons of salt, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Delecia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Delecia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Delecia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Delecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for University studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, iron and zinc.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 26 years old, a single mother of one school-going child. She has been running a photo studio for the last 20 years and earns a monthly income of KES 35,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
She has applied for her second loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more assorted clothes for sale.

She  will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Michael Mwirigi

texts.en:
Michael is a student at Strathmore. This is his story:

"My name is Michael, a student at Strathmore University doing a Bachelor of Science in Informatics. 

Strathmore University gave me a partial scholarship, 40% only. Consequently, I have applied for the Kiva loan because I have a sister who is in university and my mother struggles to pay both our fees; she is our sole bread winner. 

I would really like to avoid any interruptions due to outstanding fee balances and appreciate this opportunity given.

I hope to help other students the same in the future."

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree, Bachelor of  Science in Informatics.

loans.name: Michael Indasi

texts.en:
Michael is a student at Strathmore. This is his story:

"My name is Michael, a last-born in the family of seven siblings. 

I am a second year student in Strathmore University pursuing a degree in Business Information Technology. After completing my high school education, I stayed for five years without joining any tertiary institution due to financial constraints. Now KIVA is my only hope.

A friend of mine informed me about Kiva loans and I took a step of doing the application. This loan is the only way out for me to complete my studies. At the moment, nobody in our entire family is in a position of meeting the fees needed and this is the main reason I decided to take the loan. 

I am specializing in IT and after graduation, I aim at coming up with my own software company. My hope is to be successful and to help those children who are financially disadvantaged to achieve their dreams. Many thanks to the Kiva Community for helping people like me achieve their dreams."

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Business Information Technology at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the final months of her licensing course

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
The picture above presents Irene from the Nandi hills area of Kenya, a young farmer practicing mixed farming. She is a woman in her early thirties from a community not known for farming, but she has been earning well through agriculture. 

For the past 5 years, her primary source of income has been milk, tea, and a variety of crops she plants. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has in farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. 

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Irene believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. 

Irene awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 55 years old, married and has five children. She is a vendor selling processed meat products for income. She has been in her business for two years. She wanted to increase her merchandise as that will help her achieve a better income. 

Rosalinda is now asking for additional capital to invest in her business. She will buy hot-dogs, cured pork and bacon to sell. This will help improve her income and she will be able to save for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy processed meat products such as hot-dogs, cured pork and bacon.

loans.name: Agileo

texts.en:
Agileo is a 31 year old, married man living in Masindi Uganda. He desires to have a maize mill so as to increase his sales after harvest.

He wants a loan to buy a maize mill to enable him to process the maize himself and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy a maize mill.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.es: Romeo, tiene 39 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos, reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Romeo siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultivando maíz y frijoles y  también realizando trabajos de jornal a otras personas, pero hace 13 años decidió tener su propio cultivo de café y siempre cultivando maíz y frijoles. Esta producción la vende en la zona donde vive y es donde obtiene sus ingresos para el sostén de la familia. El ya ha solicitado varios prestamos a la institución para darle asistencia a los cultivos, actualmente solicita otro por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes, abono, foliar para darle mantenimiento a la finca de café y al cultivo de granos básicos para mejorar las cosechas. Pues su plan es seguir aumentando la producción para obtener mas ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Romeo is 39 years old, married, he has two children, and he lives in a small village of the Azacualpa municipality in Santa Bárbara.

Romeo has always worked in agriculture, growing corn and beans, and he has also worked as a day laborer for hire, but thirteen years ago he decided to have his own coffee farm as well as to continue growing corn and beans. He sells this harvest in the zone where he lives, and that is how he makes an income to provide for the family. 

He has previously requested several loans from the institution to take care of the crops. He is currently requesting another loan in the amount of 10,000 lempiras to buy fertilizers, compost, and leaf fertilizer to maintain the coffee plantation and the crops of basic grains, in order to achieve better harvests.

His plan is to continue increasing the production to generate more household income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and leaf fertilizer to maintain the coffee plantation and the crops of basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is a thirty-four-year-old  single woman with no children, living in Kasese, Uganda. For one year   Winfred has been running a retail shop selling general merchandise. She began the business to support her family.  Winfred is a hard-working woman with the dream of growing her business into a supermarket however, she is faced with a challenge of limited a capital. Winfred wants money to buy sugar, soap, cooking oil and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, cooking oil and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Maxwell

texts.en:
Maxwell wants a loan to buy sugar, soap, salt and cooking oil. He lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. His retail shop business is located  along the shores of Lake Albert. He has a motor vehicle transport business that generates more income.

Maxwell started the business to improve the standard of living of his family. He desires to build a permanent home. Inadequate capital affects his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, salt, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 44 year old, divorced, man with 6 children. He lives in Masindi-Uganda.

Wilson has a vehicle for transport. Competition for customers affect his business. He also does bricklaying to add to his income. He wants a loan to buy bricklaying materials.
