He desires to educate all his children.

loans.use: to buy bricklaying materials.

loans.name: Hilary

texts.en: Hilary is a young resident of Kawangware, an impoverished neighborhood in Nairobi, Kenya. He is a good example of young people who have shunned a life of crime and drugs to become enterprising members of society. He sells energy efficient stoves in his community and is able to earn an income. Through this loan he will be able to increase his inventory, income and impact.

loans.use: To purchase energy efficient stoves for sale.

loans.name: Bekim

texts.en:
Bekim is 32 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife takes care of their children all day while he works many long hours as a taxi driver. 

They live in an old home that has needed a lot of renovations for quite some time now. The windows and the doors of their home need to be replaced before the upcoming cold and wet winter season. Bekim is requesting a loan so that he can complete the work before the bad weather and keep his family healthy, warm, and dry. It will also keep his utility and heating costs down. 

He is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to renovate his house and complete the work before the bad weather starts.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is part of a group of young people in the informal settlement of Kawangware, Nairobi that has decided to bring change in their community. Through the sale of energy-efficient cookstoves, they have been able to save their community members a lot of money while also bringing a safer solution to people who need it the most. This loan will help Mercy purchase more stoves to expand her inventory and reach more people within her community.

loans.use: To purchase energy efficient cookstoves for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy notions.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Con tan solo 50 años de edad doña Esperanza ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio. Está casada y es madre de tres hijos ya independientes, es de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de perfumería. Inicio su negocio hace tres años con dos mil córdobas que le regalaron y así logro comprar los primeros perfumes que ofreció a sus clientes. Su esposo la apoya en todo momento. Ella comercializa sus productos en casi todos los municipios de Matagalpa y así ha logrado obtener mayores clientes. Dentro de sus metas próximas es abarcar más clientes y ofrecerles sus productos. Doña Esperanza solicita el préstamo para comprar más perfumes logrando así aumentar su inventario y ofrecerles mayor variedad a sus clientes. Ella sueña con tener una tienda de perfumes y lograr abarcar más lugares satisfaciendo así la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
At the age of 50, Doña Esperanza has been able to get ahead in her business. She is married and the mother of three children who are independent. Esperanza is a merchant who sells perfume. She started this business three years ago with 2,000 NIO that was given to her. Esperanza was able to purchase the first units of perfume that she offered to her customers. Her husband supports her in very moment. She sells her products in almost all of the districts in Matagalpa. As a result, she has been able to obtain more customers. Her next goal is to take on more customers and offer them her products.

Doña Esperanza is requesting a loan in order to buy more perfumes so that she can increase her inventory and offer more variety to her customers. Her dream is to have a perfume shop and sell in more places so that she can meet the demand from her customers.

loans.use: to buy perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 32-year-old married man with four children. He lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He sells timber to generate income. He started the business to earn a living. He faces a challenge of competition for clients. He will use the loan to roof his house.

loans.use: to roof his house.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn works hard to support two children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Annalyn requested a PHP 1,800 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Annalyn is aware that, by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is aged 32. He is married with 3 children aged between 12 and 7 years old, and all of them go to school. 

He has been selling spare parts for the past 3 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more spare parts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Ismart Changemakers Group

texts.en: Kelvin, Regina, David and Jackline are enterprising young individuals from the informal settlement of Kawangware, Kenya. Instead of sitting at home engaging in illegal activities, they have decided to become distributors of energy efficient stoves in their community. Through their work, they are able to earn an income while transforming their community. The rise in demand requires them to increase their inventory and this loan will go a long way in ensuring they can grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase energy-efficient stoves to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi

loans.name: Phiengdee Group

texts.en:
Daeng is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water-borne diseases. Daeng's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams. However, the water from natural sources in her village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking, without treatment.  

Even though some people in the village, including Daeng, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Daeng and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. 

Daeng's filter is guaranteed for two years, although most users find the filter works from three to five years. Most families report a three-fold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and overall well-being.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter, so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Brigde Group

texts.en:
This is a group of primary school teachers in a school in Nairobi. They are in their late 40's. Some use charcoal for cooking while two of them use kerosene lamps for lighting. With traditional cook stoves, there is a lot of indoor air pollution which leads to respiratory diseases and also there is a lot of charcoal consumption by the traditional stoves.

Currently on average each member spends USD 1.3 on charcoal everyday and USD 1.2 on kerosene daily. The loan will enable them purchase high efficient cook stove JIKOKOA and solar lamps SUN KING PRO 2 that will save them up to 50% of their daily consumption on charcoal and kerosene. These cook stoves also reduce smoke and carbon emissions from the charcoal thus creating a better and cleaner environment for their families while the lamps are clean energy, saving them from the fumes from kerosene lamps.

The families will be able to save USD 0.65 daily from the reduced consumption on charcoal and kerosene. This translates to USD 234 every year for at least 5 years (lifetime of the cook stove and solar lamp). This money will be saved and used for other needs like paying for their children's school fees, paying rent and making their lives better.

loans.use: to purchase highly efficient cookstoves and solar lamps

loans.name: Sulaina

texts.en:
Sulaina is married with five children who all go to school. She has additional family members. She operates a beauty salon and has been in this business for 13 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a hand dryer and more weaves, braids, relaxers, oils for sale. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and power shortages. 

She is aspiring of educating her children up to university level. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy weaves, braids, treatments, relaxers and a hand dryer.

loans.name: Carmena

texts.en:
Carmena has been selling dried fish in their village for many years to make a living. She runs her business well and it brings more income for the family. 

Carmena's previous loan used for purchasing dried fish has been repaid successfully for she had better income from this. She improved her business by having consignment in other villages. 

Carmena is taking a new loan recently to purchase additional varieties of dried fish to sell it in the villages nearby in order to increase her sales. She leave some of her stocks to her  friend's store in other villages as consignment to create  livelihood activity in their community. In the future, Carmena wants to build a house and to provide her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of dried fish to sell it in the villages nearby in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Mariefe

texts.en:
Mariefe is 40 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

Mariefe has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, five five of whom in school, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Susan is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs for her pig fattening business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 59 years old and a widow with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Julieta is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Liliane

texts.en:
Liliane is 33 years old. She is married with five children aged between 14 and 6 years; all of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been farming for the past six years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum for farming. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for farming.

loans.name: Thadeyo

texts.en:
Thadeyo is 28 years old. He is not married. He is a farmer and has been working for four years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more cattle for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for sale.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine, her mother and her 4-year-old child live in Kapan town. Armine sells women's, men's, and children's clothes, sportswear, and shoes in one of the rooms in her house. She has her loyal customers, who for many years have done their shopping with her. Armine's customers like the style of the clothes and her service.

Armine requested a loan, which she will use to purchase a new collection of clothes for the autumn and winter seasons.

Armine has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes for the autumn and winter seasons.

loans.name: Wendnsongde Group

texts.fr:
Mme ALIMATA est la représentante du groupe WENDNSONGDE. Elle se porte très bien. Marié, elle est mère de 02 enfants, le plus âgé a 09 ans et le moins âgé a 09 mois. 01 va à l’école. Elle  a 02 personnes en charge.
Madame est commerçante depuis 02 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier.
Elle  veut s’acheter 03 douzaines d’habits et 03 douzaines de chaussures.
Mme ALIMATA veut épargner ses bénéfices  et réinvestir dans l’activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de vente de prêt à porter.
texts.en: Alimata is the Wendnsongde group representative. She is doing very well. She is married and the mother of two children, the eldest of whom is 8 years old and the youngest, 9 months. One of her children goes to school. She is also responsible for 2 other people. Alimata has been selling clothing for 2 years. She gets her supplies at her local market. Her customers are the inhabitants of her district. She would like to buy 3 dozen items of clothing and 3 dozen pairs of shoes. Alimata would like to save her profits and to reinvest in her business. She aims to open a shop selling ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.use: to buy 3 dozen items of clothing and 3 dozen pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase ready-made women's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Tazeem

texts.en:
Tazeem is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 20 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Tazeem has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Tazeem's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Tazeem plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. 

Tazeem is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance expense for her husband's taxi

loans.name: Insafa

texts.en:
Insafa is a 38-year-old married woman and a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for 20 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Insafa's husband needs to perform maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is poor, and it requires maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to perform maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Insafa has applied for a Kiva loan from its Field Partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Insafa's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transportation services to earn a profitable income. Insafa also plans to build savings with the profit of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Insafa is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to her husband's taxi

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
This is a group of primary school teachers in a school in Nairobi within Umoja Estate. They are in their late 30's and early 40's and they all use charcoal for cooking. With traditional cook stoves, there is a lot of indoor air pollution which leads to respiratory diseases and also there is a lot of charcoal consumption by the traditional stoves.

Currently on average each member spends USD 1.3 on charcoal everyday. The loan will enable them purchase high efficient cook stoves JIKOKOA that will save them up to 50% of their daily consumption on charcoal. These cook stoves also reduce smoke and carbon emissions from the charcoal thus creating a better and cleaner environment for their families.

The families will be able to save USD 0.65 daily from the reduced consumption on charcoal. This translates to USD 234 every year for at least 5 years (lifetime of the cook stove). The money they save from reduced charcoal consumption will be channeled to their monthly pension contributions which shall be used upon retirement

loans.use: to purchase a high-efficiency cookstove

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita is a young woman who is 31 years old, is married, and has two children (one son and one daughter). They are too young for school. They live in their own kachha house (a mud, bamboo and straw house) in a village named Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district.

Kabita's husband, Phulen, is a cultivator who mainly grows vegetables. He cultivates varieties of crops in his land, Kabita also assists him in his work.  

Now he wants to start paddy cultivation as paddy is a staple food in West Bengal. He can earn a good profit from this crop. But his main challenge is capital to buy agricultural supplies. Kabita has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to help pay for good quality paddy seeds, insecticides and fertilizers which will be very helpful for a good harvest. 

Kabita has many goals and dreams. Among them are to provide her children higher education and to grow the farm land. 

She conveys her thanks to BJS and Kiva for this financial assistant.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 57 years old and is from Palompon, Leyte. She is married with three dependents. Josefina and her husband work hard to support their family. Her husband is a fisherman and Josefina sells fish for an income. Their business has been supporting their household needs for ten years now. 

Josefina is asking for a loan to buy styro foam, weighing scales and plywood. She hopes to make an improvement in her livelihood, and with the loan she is optimistic about this change. 

In the future, she hopes to make her business more profitable and for her children to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy styro foam, weighing scales and plywood

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married mother of three children and two of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 10 years. She generates additional income from selling cold drinks, and works seven days a week.

She has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality of used clothes. She aspires to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Sabuhi

texts.en:
Sabuhi is 28 years old. He is an IDP (internally displaced persons ) from Fuzuli city, and now is living in Araz Zargar village. Sabuhi is engaged and in the near future wants to get married. 

Today Sabuhi wants to support his business and for that he has applied for a loan in amount of 1,200 AZN ( Azerbaijan New Manat ) from Komak company. With this amount Sabuhi planning to buy more cows. He say great thanks for all loans from Kiva organization.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is grateful that he was previously granted a PHP 30,000 loan, which he used to buy office and school supplies that were needed in his business. He also sells "buco" (young coconut fruit). Through his earnings, he is able to support his family and meet their daily basic needs.

He would like to apply for another loan, this time in the amount of PHP 50,000.00. He will use it to buy more "buco" and some office and school supplies. "Bico" (made from young coconut fruit) is a favorite refreshing drink of Filipinos, not only for its yummy taste, but also for its nutritional value. Both local residents and tourists love to drink young coconut juice and eat its sweet meat inside. He is thanking God and you, in advance, for the financial assistance that will be given him. He appears in the photo in his office/school supplies business.

William aims to open another outlet, for both his office and school supplies and "buco" selling businesses. He dreams of sending his youngest child to the best school, for college. He prays for a happy and quiet life. He faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional "buco" fruit (young coconut fruit) and office supplies.

loans.name: Yacob

texts.en:
Yacob is a 44-year-old man who is married to Tersia, a 43-year-old housewife. They have been blessed with three children; Efri, 23; Ari, 18 and Jeftan, 14, a Junior High School student. Yacob has been a well digger since his youth. He had learned from his father how to dig or search for the best place to get potential water. Most of the wells in his community were dug by him. The common depth of the wells which Yacob usually digs is between 20-35 meters. Yacob needs one to two months to complete a well, depending on the ground type.   

Yacob often uses his spare time, especially in the rainy season, to run a motor taxi. By doing that job, Yacob could get extra income. However, he still has the responsibility to pay the motorbike installment. He has no cash at the moment to pay the due installment as he has used the money for another priority, therefore he applied for a loan of 4,500,000 IDR from TLM. The loan is used to pay the motorcycle installments.

loans.use: to pay the installments for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
His name is Ricky, he is 23, and a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Married to Pauline, he has no children yet. Ricky works doubly hard to start a family and is looking forward to having children soon.

Ricky operates a tricycle, which carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Palawan, tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, to church, to their friend’s homes, and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other. He earns a minimum of PHP 400 a day.

To help him continue his transport business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, which he will use for repairs and maintenance of his tricycle.  It is very important that his tricycle unit is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service.  He is positive that this will boost his income, as tricycle transportation is really a need in their place.

Ricky dreams to have another tricycle unit to improve his income in order to give his family a better life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and were he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Ma. Criscynthia

texts.en:
Her name is Maria Criscynthia, age 51 and a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines.  She is married to Elmerato, a cook, and they have two children. One child is in high school and one in the elementary level. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs, and to send her children to school. 

Criscynthia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-PHPs-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 300 PHP a day. 

To help her continue operation of her general store business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, biscuits, noodles, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are their source to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Criscynthia hopes to maintain and grow her business so she and they could have a better life. She strives so hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a hardworking entrepreneur who raises chickens in the Philippines. She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens. Susana has been in this business for ten years. Susana earns more additional income from food vending and machinery rental.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to buy more farmland in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Florda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Florda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from direct-selling Avon products. Florda is borrowing PHP 17,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to  purchase more stocks to sell through her general store business, like chips, canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Florda has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell, like chips, canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard lives with her husband in Stepanavan in the Lori region.  She has a higher education; she graduated from the faculty of Geography at Yerevan State University. For more than 32 years she works in the pedagogical sphere. Now she works at a school as a geography teacher. She works in her city’s high school after which pupils are going to enter higher educational institutions. She also gives private courses in geography at her house, preparing her pupils for passing the entrance examinations. 

Alvard lives with her husband in a nice house. Her husband is a farmer with many years of experience in farming. 
Avard asks a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and professional literature. As she says, a computer will help her to have new teaching materials and a lot of new information from the literature, She will be able to make both her lessons at the school and her private courses very productive and informative.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 37 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Ailyn has borrowed and paid her loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs.

Ailyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Tatevik

texts.en:
This nice lady’s name is Tatevik. She lives in Vanadzor city of the Lori region and she is 32 years old. 

Tatevik has two higher pedagogical educations: She graduated Moscow State University in the faculty of Foreign Languages, and in Armenian, she graduated Yerevan State University in the faculty of Sociology. 

Already for five years she has worked at the Vanadzor city's University as a lecturer of English language and literature. 

Now Tatevik is on maternity leave; she has a son (school-aged) and a daughter who is 1 year old. Despite being at home, Tatevik continues her pedagogical activities. At her house in a separated room, Tatevik gives paid private courses of English language and literature, preparing pupils for the entrance examinations. 

Now Tatevik will be very happy to receive this loan, which she will spend on the purchase of a computer and professional literature for her pedagogical occupations.

loans.use: to buy computer and professional literature for her pedagogical occupations

loans.name: Charene

texts.en:
Charene is 31 years old and married, with five children who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Charene runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

Charene has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as bread, biscuits, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds of a high-quality breed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry for her farm

loans.name: Sanh

texts.en:
Sanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong would like to take a further loan to buy tofu to sell from her store, and to buy motorcycle parts to repair motorcycles. 

Hong's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to gradually expand her business by buying tofu to sell and motorcycle parts to repair motorcycles

loans.name: Malemnganbi Chanu

texts.en:
Malemnganbi is a 25-year-old humble person who always has a smiling face. She is pictured with her mother. She is the eldest among five and loved to take care of her younger siblings ever since childhood while her parents were away for work. All her siblings go to school. Her parents barely sustain the family with their inadequate income for paying the expenses of the household. There was never a time that I had peace of mind, said her mother. A blessing has showered upon our family this time, now that my eldest daughter is able to start working in a respectable profession. I am happy and hope that she will be able to support her younger siblings in the near future. She has been very supportive to her siblings and all of them were happy about her new job profile. 

Malemnganbi was selected as a flight attendant at an interview held in town. She had been very happy about the good news and shared it with her family and friends. In the midst of her good fortune, the one thing that could not assure her happiness was the large sum of money she had to pay for the refundable security deposit so that she could start her training as a cabin crew member in the aviation academy. Considering her family's financial condition, she was anxious about where she would get that amount of money. While she was in high tension and sharing about her financial insecurities, her friend, whose aunt is a member of Kiva, told her that through WSDS she could take an education loan. She shared the news with her mother and they were delighted about the news. There are always times when the family is going through ups and down due to the lack of finances.  

She will pay her security deposit with the loan she took from Kiva and join the training. She is very happy and thanks WSDS for providing the loan during her family's critical conditions. She will repay the loan with her salary when she starts earning. She wishes to continue supporting her family like she always did. She express her immense gratitude to all those generous lenders who are part of building her career and making it possible.

loans.use: To pay the security deposit for a flight attendant training course.

loans.name: Thana Group

texts.en: Hieng's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village, including Hieng, are able to buy bottled water. The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Hieng is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Hieng due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing  the amount of money used to  purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Hadsaykhun Group

texts.en: Chinda's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Chinda's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Chinda is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Chinda, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Chinda and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Chinda's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Aviito

texts.en:
Aviito is forty years old, happily married and blessed with four children. Being the only boy in his family, he shoulders the responsibility of catering to the whole family.

He is a farmer and at the same time he is a cattle herdsman. He previously took a loan and used it to improve his banana plantation. Now that banana bacterial wilt has become a prevalent problem in Uganda, he wants to invest in coffee plantations, which requires him to invest capital, some of which he does not have. He is requesting 4,000,000 UGX to buy decomposed cow dung and grass to mulch the garden for improved yields. He is hardworking.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a 53 year old Palestinian refugee who grew up in a Palestinian refugee camp located in Beirut. Her husband is also a Palestinian refugee from the same camp and together they have three sons and a daughter. Her daughter is still in school while her sons have completed their studies at school and started working.

She owns a well-known bakery inside the camp, in which she has been working with her husband since August 2000. The business is therefore the family's main source of income, in addition to the contribution of her three working sons who also cover part of the family's expenses. 

Ahlam is asking for a 2,057,552 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She plans to use the loan to buy new equipment that will increase her productivity and her bakery's production. Such an expansion in her business will allow her to serve more customers and significantly increase her family's income which will improve their living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her bakery

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 31 year old Palestinian refugee who was born and raised inside one of the Palestinian refugee camps located in the South. He has been married since 2008 to a young Palestinian refugee who lives in the same camp and with whom he has two children who are currently in middle school. His wife being unemployed, Ali's business has always been the family's only source of income in addition to the modest aid received from different organization.

Three years ago, despite unstable socio-economic conditions in the camp, Ali decided to establish an amusement center in which children come from all over the camp to play computer and electronic games. The center is known in the camp as a main place of gathering for all young Palestinians, as shown for the two little boys in the picture. 

In order to expand his business and increase its capacity, Ali is asking for a 3,083,000 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from field partner Ibdaa. With this amount, he is planning to buy new computers and tables for his amusement center. Such an expansion will allow him to welcome a higher number of children in his center. 

In such a way, he will be able to increase his income and provide his wife and daughters with improved living conditions and a better future.

loans.use: to buy new computers and tables for his amusement center

loans.name: Heyran

texts.en: Heyran is 54 years old; she is a widow; her husband was died in Karabakh war. She lives in Mahmudlu village of the Füzuli region with her parents. They are IDP (internally displaced persons) from native land Füzuli city. Heyran has a few cows and she has been in the animal breeding business for 12 years. She prepares dairy products (cheese, yogurt, etc.) and sells in the local bazaar and to her neighbors to earn money. Today she needs 2300 AZN, so that  she can buy hay and straw for her animals for the coming winter. She is thankful to Kiva organization for help.

loans.use: to buy hay and straw for her farm animals

loans.name: Mahammadali

texts.en:
Mahammadali is a 52-year-old man. He is living in Ahmadbayli village of Fuzuli region with his wife and two sons. His wife is a housewife; she helps her husband on his business. Mahammadali’s elder son is 20 years old; he is studying in college, and the younger son is 17 years old. He is going to school. His family members are IDP (Internally displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city. 

Mahammadali has been in animal breeding business. He buys little calves, raises them, and sells them in a local bazaar to earn money. 

Today he wants to increase his business, and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy two calves. 

Mahammadali is thankful for the help from the Kiva organization.

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion is a married mother of three children and two of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis, and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She generates additional income from selling piped water.  

She works seven days a week. Her major business challenge is transportation. She is aspiring of owing a fully stocked stall and also of buying a plot of land.  She resides in her own house and the family has electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy out-of-stock items for his food stall business

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is requesting a new loan to buy coffee and beverages to sell in her store. Huong's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, coffee and beverages, specifically

loans.name: Lezel

texts.en:
Lezel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lezel is 37 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Lezel has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

Lezel has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is 39 years old, and she lives in the village of Khachardzan in the Tavush region. Ruzanna has a nice and big family; she lives with her husband, three sons and her mother-in-law. Ruzanna has no higher education, and with her husband, she started at a very young age in farming and agriculture. 

On her farm, Ruzanna has 7 cows, 2 bulls, a calf, a piglet and 40 chickens. Thanks to her farm, she sells milk, macun (Armenian national dairy-product), meat and eggs. Her plot of land also brings her profit, since she cultivates on it and sells potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, onions and greens. Ruzanna says that she is happy with her farming, and all her family members help her greatly; her husband helps in agricultural occupations, and her sons help her in the care of farm cattle. Now Ruzanna has plans to enlarge the number of her cattle.

This loan, in an amount of 600,000 Armenian drams, will help her to buy a cow and two bulls. She says this will surely make a greater profit for her, and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a cow and two bulls

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 57-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in rentals and earns a salary. He faces challenges of low capital, but additionally has hopes of having all his children educated to higher levels of learning. 

Joseph needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 54 years old and married with five children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to offer for sale.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to offer for sale.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Dep

texts.en:
Dep, 58, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired.

Dep has been running a business of selling dishwashing liquid and phone cards in front of her house for nine years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a larger stock of dishwashing liquid and phone cards to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy dishwashing liquid and phone cards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a 20-year old college undergraduate.  She lives in La Carlota City.   She is married to Alfred, who works as a sugarcane laborer.  They have a 1 year old daughter.  Their total monthly family income is only Php 4000 ($91).  Jean has long seen the need to help her family but didn’t have the means until she learned about the 2 months training program of BagoSphere that could lead to a call center job.  Now that she has passed BagoSphere’s selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition.  Once Jean starts earning, she can help provide her family’s basic needs and then save some money for her daughter’s education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 28 years old, a vocational graduate, and lives in Valladolid.  He is married to Krisna, who works as a call center agent in Transcom.  They have one son aged six months.  Their total monthly family income is Php 19000 ($432).  Joseph would also want to be a call center agent like his wife so that they can work together in building a better life for their young family. However, he needs to be equipped with skills so he can get the job. Thus, he came to BagoSphere and would need your help to finance his tuition. With your generosity, he'll take the chance to be trained as he aims for a better future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Mark Anthony

texts.en: Mark Anthony is an 18-year old high school graduate, and lives in a rural area in Bago City.  He belongs to a family of 6.  His father is a feeds delivery truck driver, and his mother is a housewife.  Mark Anthony has 3 siblings.  His eldest sister is in college and his 2 younger brothers are in high school and elementary.  Their total monthly family income of Php 10500 ($239) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs.  This motivates Mark Anthony to find means to help the family have more income that's why he braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job.  Apart from helping his family, Mark Anthony also dreams to be a call center agent and to finish his studies.  Your generosity in funding his loan will help Mark Anthony have a better income soon.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en: Sherly is a 29-year old high school graduate and lives in Valladolid. She is married to Junrie who works as a  construction worker in Cebu City. They have 3 children; their eldest is 10 years old and the youngest is 2.  Their total monthly family income is only Php 8000 ($182). Sherly wants to help provide her family's basic needs and then save some money for her children's education. The 2-month training program of BagoSphere is her gateway to a job in the call center industry. Your assistance is funding her tuition will allow her to build a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a 19-year old graduate of a vocational course, and lives in a rural area in Bago City.  She belongs to a family of 6.  Her father works as a farmer, and her mother is a housewife.  Faith has 3 siblings.  Her eldest brother works as a farmer and her 2 younger sisters are still in high school level.  Their total monthly family income of Php 5000 ($114) is not enough to provide for their basic needs.  This motivates Faith to find means to help the family have more income that’s why she braved the selection process in Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job.  Apart from helping her family, Faith also dreams of having her own house someday. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Faith have a better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Songkonemai Group

texts.en: Thong's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Thong's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Thong is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Thong, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Thong and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Thong's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
This is John. He is a dairy farmer in Awasi, Kisumu, Kenya. He developed a passion for cows from his father who reared indigenous cattle. The cows produced milk that he sold to the locals. He also sold the cattle to get school fees for him and his siblings.

Whereas he started with local indigenous cows, he has progressed and replaced all the local breeds with cross-breeds which produce more milk. 

John has plans to grow his business to become a recognized dairy farmer in Awasi. He will have a high milk production, higher incomes and also provide employment to many. A loan from Kiva will support him build feeding troughs for his cows and also increase his herd by one more dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a high breed dairy cow and construct feeding troughs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
Nabi is a driver. He is 36 years old, married and has a child. His child is eleven years old and goes to fifth class of school. They are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Füzuli City and now live in Füzuli–Yaglivend Village. 

It’s noted that Nabi is a driver, so he has been involved in the transportation of passengers. Today he has applied for a loan in the amount of 700 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) for repairs for his car’s engine. He is thankful to Kiva for the help.

loans.use: to pay for repairs for his car’s engine.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien, 54 years old, is divorced and has two children, one son and one daughter. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a food stall to selling bread and beefsteak. She started this business for four years. 

Lien intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy good quality beef and ingredients to make better food for selling. The additional capital will enable her to increase her income from this business. She hopes her business runs smoothly, and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy beef and ingredients

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is 40 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income as a worker in a local company. Oanh runs a food store selling beef and noodles for earning a living. 

She started her business eight years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a better quality of ingredients and noodles to make food for selling for her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy noodles and ingredients to make food for selling at her stall.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is a 37-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He buys cattle for fattening as his major business. He faces a challenge of prolonged droughts.

Geofrey has a dream to start up a business to increase his income.

He needs a loan to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, 32, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have earned an income running a beauty salon in front of their house. 

She started this business nine years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of nail making and nail care products to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy nail making and nail care products to stock her beauty salon.

loans.name: Yceun's Group

texts.en: Yceun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yceun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as construction worker and factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family and save money on medical expenses.

loans.name: Jennivie

texts.en: Jennivie is a 30-year old high school graduate.   She lives in Bago City.   She is married to Alberto, who works as a machine operator in Cebu City.  They have a 1 year old daughter.   Their total monthly family income is only Php 7000 ($159).  Jennivie currently takes care of her daughter, but believes she can do more for her and her husband if she finds a job that will bring food to their table.  She wants to be a call center agent that's why she underwent the selection process at BagoSphere that she eventually passed. What she needs now is financial assistance so she can pay for her tuition. Your help on this will benefit not only Jennivie but her whole family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Miryam

texts.es:
Miryam es una mujer soltera, emprendedora, vive en Huaraz junto a su familia. No tuvo hijos debido a que cuando era joven decidió trabajar para sacar adelante a sus padres y hermanos, con el fruto de su labor como trabajadora social pudo apoyar a sus hermanos quienes hoy se sienten agradecidos con ella. Es una persona muy amable que prefirió sacrificarse por el bienestar de los suyos.
Miryam quiere arreglar su casita, es por ello que va a utilizar el crédito para poder pintarrajear las paredes y cambiar el sistema de seguridad de su hogar, así su familia se sentirá más segura y ella continuará con su labor para vivir una vida tranquila y feliz.
texts.en:
Miryam is a single woman. She is an enterprising individual who lives with her family in Huaraz. Miryam has no children because she decided when she was younger that she would work in order to help her parents and siblings get ahead. Through her efforts as a social worker, Miryam has been able to support her siblings and today they are very grateful to her. She is a friendly person who prefers to make sacrifices for the welfare of others.

Miryam wants to make repairs to her small house. For this reason, she will use the loan to plaster the walls and replace the safety features in her home. This will help her family feel more secure and she can continue her work so that she can have a peaceful and happy life.

loans.use: to plaster the walls and replace the locks in her home.

loans.name: Agellina

texts.en:
Agellina is 35 years old, married and together with her spouse, has been blessed with five children. She is a farmer, and she has been in the business for five years. She also has a grocery business. 

She plans to use this loan to add more stock of goats and sheep for rearing. She will use the anticipated profits to open a butchery.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to grow her business to make more income and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for rearing.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty sells beverages such as sodas, milk and cakes in Masindi-Uganda. She desires to be self-sustainable. She started the business to earn a living. Competition is a great challenge in her business. She needs a loan to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home system and save money

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 22 years old and lives in Ermera. She is a businesswoman, and she is selling clothes. 

She is happy to do her activities because many people come to buy. She earns a good income from her business. She said that living in a town is very competitive for earning money unless she does some activities that are profitable in order to survive. Looking for ways to earn money, she is still happy to do her business. 

She started selling her clothes in 2008 with her own working capital of $1,000. She is applying for a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more clothes such as T-shirts, short sleeve shirts, long sleeve shirts, jackets, and other things to sell. 

Irene also raises animals in her place, like cows, pigs, chickens, goat and dogs.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, short sleeve shirts, long sleeve shirts, jackets, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Sam Ath

texts.en: Sam Ath (28) lives with his wife on the Tonglesap river. In the dry season they farm rice and in the rainy season they fish. They have three daughters Soksan (10) Pisey (10) and Reaksa (5). The two oldest girls are in school and the youngest one stays home. They would like to own a solar system to save money on their energy costs.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system and save money

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home system and save money

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien would like to take another loan to buy more, better-quality materials, with which to make flowerpots. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more, better-quality materials, with which to make flower pots.

loans.name: Nu

texts.en: Nu would like to take another loan to buy more fish and chickens to raise and sell. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fish and chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en:
Duyen is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Hazbije

texts.en:
Hazbije is 35 years old and the mother of one child. They live in a Roma community, under very poor conditions, and have to work very hard to make enough money to put food on their table. Her husband works very hard and long hours transporting goods for others, but the salary he makes is very low.

Therefore, Hazbije contributes everything she can by running her own handicraft business. She has a very pleasant personality, which has helped to create a strong client base, and she has been working for many years in her area.

For many years, Hazbije has been working with a worn and old machine. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase a new machine for her business, allowing her to be able to work more effectively and efficiently.

Hazbije hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business even more and be able to contribute more money to her family. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine for her handicraft business, allowing her to be able to work more effectively and efficiently.

loans.name: Pamella

texts.en:
Pamella is a small-scale farmer from Nyamira area of Kenya. She has been doing crop farming for six years. Her primary income source is tea. 

Pamella is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Poultry is kept by African women mostly for subsistence, because they move through life oblivious of the business potential they are missing out on. Pamella seeks to produce eggs in large volumes to sell to neighbours, institutions, hotels and at the local market. 

Income from this investment will help her settle high business expenses associated with tea farming. Profits will be ploughed back into the business to acquire more poultry. When Pamella was asked how the loan will be of benefit to her family, she replied, "It will make their basic needs be provided for easily."

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 54 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Loida works very hard to provide for them.

Loida runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, school supplies, and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Loida would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en: Tadeo lives in Masindi Uganda. He sells drinks such as sodas and beers in a bar. He grows sunflowers to boost his income. He dreams of expanding his business into a depot for drinks. Tadeo started the business to support and to provide for the needs of his family. He needs a loan to buy sodas and beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas, and beers to sell.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen would like to take another loan to buy hair dye and more hair care products to meet her customers' demands. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hair dye and better quality hair care products for her business.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en: Venantie is 62 years old. She is married and has one child who is 25 years old. She sells food and has been working in this business for 10 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more bananas and cassavas for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and cassavas for resale.

loans.name: Majid

texts.en:
Majid is a 45 year old man. He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children. 

He gets income from his motorcycle business. Competition affects his business. He wants a loan to buy a another motorcycle. 

He has a great dream of educating his children.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Nghia

texts.en:
Nghia is 44 years old and married. She has two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She is running a general store. Her husband supports his family through repairing motorbikes.

She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is a long-time client, she is married with seven children; five of whom attend school. Aidah is a farmer and also does coffee trade as her major source of income; she has done this business for over seven years. Aidah depends on this business for all her financial needs, however she found that her capital was insufficient to buy more coffee from the area, which if she bought would increase her sales. 

Aidah has been taking loans from Ugafode which has enabled her to expand her business, educate her children, and acquire more assets like land. She is taking this loan of shs 5,000,000 to buy more coffee to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: To buy coffee for resale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Gladys, a hardworking woman. She is 59 years old and blessed with five children. She practices maize, bean and poultry farming. 

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in November 2013 and is grateful for the enterprise development training. She is applying to a loan to purchase chicken feed and supplements for her chickens. She hopes this will help improve their productivity to meet the rising demand for eggs and chicken. This will improve her income, putting her in a position to meet her family's needs, such as food and education.

Gladys is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 62 years old, and living with her family at Peñablanca. She operates a store for income. She sells grocery items in retail. She wanted to gain more income by selling a variety of goods. She is now asking for PHP 12,000 to invest in her store. She will buy canned goods, biscuits, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell. She hopes to continue improving her sales and to save additional revenue for the family's emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells flour and sugar and other basic necessities. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a busy market area and her primary customers are local buyers from the town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high tax being charged. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add up fresh products like maize flour and cooking fat to be sold to the customers. Her business goal is to open a mini supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the  future, she will be self-reliant and become a business mentor. She will be using the profits to repay the loan and for personal development.

loans.use: to purchase retail products like cooking fat and maize flour.

loans.name: Famida

texts.en:
Famida is married and a mother. She lives in a rented house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
	
Famida operates a business selling clothes and shoes at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

Famida decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan of KES 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 26 years old and married with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Josie requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like pants, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Josie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Josie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like pants, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en:
Dieu is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of food and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rwengyiri Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
The group is comprised of only women who mostly deal in small-scale businesses. The group thanks the Kiva lenders for being on their side to support their small businesses.

Allen is a divorced woman with three children, of which two are in school except one who dropped out due to lack of tuition. Allen operates a bar in the trading centre. She runs her business with capital of UGX 300,000.

She requested for a loan of UGX 500,000 to add in her working capital so as to increase her cash flow. She will use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children and buy them a few basic needs. Her customers are people around the centre. Her major challenge is competition, and laws that prohibit early drinking, which affects her during her business operations since she has to wait for her customers until late in the evening.

Despite all these challenges, Allen is a very hardworking woman who is striving hard to provide a good education, and a good standard of living for her children.

loans.use: To buy locally processed beer and soda for sell

loans.name: G.s. Rancho Grande Group

texts.es: María, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Gracias, Lempira.  María tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la agricultura en cultivos de maíz,frijol y café. El cultivo de café es lo que le genera mayor ingreso, y esta producción la vende en grano despulpado y secado en la misma zona donde vive. Ella decidió solicitar un préstamo por 5,000 lempiras en forma grupal, este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de abono para fertilizar la finca de café y mejorar la producción. Su idea es tener un buen patrimonio familiar para vivir mejor. El grupo que han formado se llama Rancho Grande, formado por 3 mujeres que se dedican a la agricultura de café, maíz y frijol y viven en la misma comunidad. El préstamo grupal es por 13,000 lempiras para comprar abono y fertilizar su finca de café. En la foto esta Mirna a la izquierda, sigue Rosa y María Lucia a la derecha.
texts.en:
Maria, 44 years old, is a single mother, has 4 children and lives in a village belonging to the city of Gracias, Lempira. Maria has been making a living in agriculture for 15 years, growing corn, beans and coffee. The cultivation of coffee is the one which generates the most income and she sells this product as a pulped and dried grain in the same area where she lives.

She decided to request a loan for 5,000 Lempiras, on a group basis. She will invest this loan in buying fertilizer for the coffee plantation and to improve production. Her idea is to have good family assets to live better. 

The group they have formed is named Rancho Grande, made up of 3 women who make a living cultivating coffee, corn and beans and who live in the same community. The group loan is for 13,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizer for their coffee plantation. In the photograph, Mirna is on the left, followed by Rosa and Maria Lucia on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the coffee plantation.

loans.name: Khoi's Group

texts.en:
Khoi is 52 years old and lives with two daughters and her husband who is retired. For the past two years Khoi has been running a grocery store selling many kinds of vegetables to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a 7-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is the second from left wearing a floral top and bottom. Each of the other group members is requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. 

Khoi is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of vegetables to sell from her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and to save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy better quality and variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Tekoporave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Tekopora Rekavo  está en el 1º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo, que está incursionando en el programa de eliminación de la pobreza, trabajando para poder ayudarse. Son en total 18, cada una ejemplo de lucha.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Inocencia ella  se dedica a la venta de animales, masas dulces y saladas, leche, huevo, queso, y otros productos, ella es una mujer por demás trabajadora, que con el fruto del esfuerzo trata de salir adelante.
Ella comenta que pide este préstamo para la compra de pollitos y materia prima para elaborar las comidas que hace para la venta. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group named Tekopora Rekavo is in the first cycle of the women’s committee program. It is a new group that is venturing into the poverty elimination program, working to be able to help themselves. They are 18 in total, each one an example of struggle.

One of the members is Inocencia. She makes a living selling animals, sweet breads and salads, milk, eggs, cheese and other products. She is a very hardworking woman who tries to succeed with the fruits of her labor. 

She says that she requests this loan to buy chicks and raw ingredients for preparing the food that she makes to sell. She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving which will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy chicks and raw ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora was born in 1988. She lives with her parents in South Tajikistan. Gulnora is widowed and has no children. She has returned after the death of her husband to the house of her parents. 

She began her own business two years ago with the buying and selling of nuts. Gulnora sells nuts in a local market, where she has a selling place. Gulnora’s parents help her with managing the business. She is developing the business little by little.
