She is going to increase working capital now, and in this way maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy nuts for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy nuts for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine has been selling cosmetic products in her community to make a living. By collecting cash and installment payments she was able to repay her previous loan, used for buying cosmetic products, successfully. She has done her business well with her motorcycle, which she used for transportation purposes. Her income increased as well as the number of her clients.

She took a new loan recently in order to buy more variety of cosmetic products including hair, spa and facial products in addition to her stocks.

She hopes someday to have a stall in the local market where she can do her business.

loans.use: to buy more variety of cosmetic products including hair, spa and facial products.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a married man with four children living in Hoima, Uganda. He grows maize and beans to sell. He does cattle fattening for his supplementary income. He desires to educate his children to University. Wilson started this business to be able to cater for the family needs. He wants a loan to grow maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to grow more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: St Jude Kitonozi Group

texts.en:
William is a 74-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is a member of St Jude Kitonozi Group, where members guarantee each other to get a loan. 

William sells drinks in a bar. He started the business to sustain his family. He has got a farming business to generate income. He dreams of business expansion. He is requesting a loan to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Huu

texts.en:
Huu, 60, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a general store in front of their house. She started this business 14 years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products such as fast food, and spices. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products to sell such as fast food and spices.

loans.name: Vu

texts.en:
Vu is 30 years old and married. He has two children and lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife support their family through running a general store. He has started this activity two years ago.

He intends to use his loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar, sanitation items, beverages and coffee. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and to save money for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, sugar, sanitation items, beverages and coffee.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna with her husband (a pensioner) and her daughter (she works as a lecturer), lives in the village Azatamut, in Tavush region. She has vocational education.  She has a specialty of pianist, and for many years she worked at the music school of her village as a teacher of piano. She has not worked at the school since 2005 and so she established her business. At the city’s wholesale market she sells clothes for men and women, and also a small assortment of children clothes. 

She says that during the 10 years of having this trading business, she has managed to have her regular customers.  Thanks to them, she manages to keep her business going, which is the main source of income for her family. Now Ruzanna asks a loan of 600,000 AMD in order to buy a new winter collection of clothes for men, women and children for her trading business.

loans.use: to buy a new winter collection of clothes for men, women and children for her trading business.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu, 35, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is working in construction. She earns an income running a general store. 

She started this business ten years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products such as food, sugar, beverages for selling from her store.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food, sugar, beverages for selling from her store.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, 49, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her two children. She earns money selling soft drinks. 

She would like  a loan to buy bulk quantities of  soft drinks to sell and meet her customers' needs. 

She  hopes that her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Nongmieng Group

texts.en:
Thongkan's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village, including Thongkan’s, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Thongkan is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter.   The filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Thongkan due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing  the amount of money used to  purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Victoria Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo nuevo, que se formo con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Encarnación, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Audelina, ha podido crecer y a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo, como así también por medio de la venta en su despensa ha ido creciendo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que se destaca en el grupo por ser muy solidaria con las demás compañeras.
La Sra. Audelina solicita de este préstamo para la compra de  insumos   para  su negocio, como ser verduras, frutas, enlatados, leche, carne y demás, lo que le permitirá poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This is a new group, created through the coming together of several neighbors and friends in the city of Encarnación. They are participating in a poverty elimination program where each one is putting in their best effort in order to succeed.

One of the members, Audelina, has been able to grow through effort and constant work, as well as through sales in her grocery store,

She is a very hard-working person who stands out in the group for being very supportive with the other members.

Audelina  is requesting this loan in order to purchase supplies for her business, such as vegetables, fruit, canned goods, milk, meat, and other items. This will allow her to be able to continue with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruit, canned goods, milk, meat, and other items for stocking her grocery store.

loans.name: Mavjigul

texts.ru: Мавчигулу 48 лет. Она живет в городке Дангара. Мавчигул проживает вместе с мужем и тремя детьми. Старшему сыну  22 года он студент ВУЗа. Младшему сыну 17 лет, а дочке 13. Они ученики средней общеобразовательной школы. Муж Мавчигула строитель. Сама Мавчигул работает на дому портнихой. Это очень удобная работа и приносит хороший доход. Мавчигул хочет купить новую швейную машинку, чтобы ускорить темп своей работы, принимать и выполнять больше заказов на шитье женских платьев, и уверенна, что новая машинка даст ей такую возможность. Поддержите ее!
texts.en: Mavjigul is 48 years old.  She lives in the city of Dangara with her husband and her three children.  Her oldest son is 22 years old and a student at an institute of higher education.  Her youngest son is 17 years old and her daughter is 13.  Both of them are currently in secondary school.  Mavjigul's husband works as a builder, and Mavjigul herself works as a seamstress, from home.  This type of work is very convenient and allows her to make a good income.  Mavjigul wants to buy a new sewing machine in order to increase her pace of work, and to take in and fulfill more orders.  Mavjigul sews women's dresses and she is confident that a new sewing machine will allow her to reach her goals.  Please support her!

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald has been in his piggery business for over four years and it is run with the help of his family. He had his previous loan which he used for buying feed and other supplies and with his generated revenue, it was repaid successfully. 

To improve his business, Ronald bought more piglets out of the revenue collected. Recently, he took a new loan from Gata Daku MPC in order to buy feeding supplies to boost his pigs so as to have more income for the family. He is hopeful for the improvement of his business in order to augment their living situation in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies to boost his pigs so as to have more income for his family.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga, 44, is single and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. He earns money through his business designing and printing name cards and other products. He has been doing this business for fourteen years. 

Nga would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of papers and a printing machine to meet his customers' needs. He hopes his business will go smoothly and he can make enough to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy materials and a printing machine for his business.

loans.name: Nadon Group

texts.en:
Khamma's village gets water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Khamma's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.

Khamma is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases, most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter.

While some people in the village, including Khamma, are able to buy bottled water, having the water filter increases her disposable income by decreasing the amount of money she used to spend on bottled water.

Khamma and other filter users also spend less money on charcoal or firewood--or spend less time foraging for firewood--to boil water.

Khamma's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3 to 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 39-year-old male with a general store to sell sugar, soap, rice, and oil.  He earns a salary that adds to his income.  He started the business to improve his standard of living.

He faces a challenge of inadequate capital and needs a loan to buy sugar and soap.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap.

loans.name: Naoneua Group

texts.en:
Vee is excited that she and her group members were able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water borne diseases. Vee's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in her village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  

Even though some people in the village are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Vee and other filter users experience a decrease in the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. 

Vee's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and over all well-being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Reyes

texts.es: Reyes de 57 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamacas desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados y ya tiene clientela establecida que lo prefieren por la calidad y los buenos precios, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, él está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos y nylon de colores por mayor, para continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Reyes is 57 years old and has been making hammocks for several years. He sells his products in different markets and he has loyal customers who choose to buy from him because of the quality and fair prices of his goods. He lives in his own house with his family. He is requesting a loan in order to buy thread and different colored nylon in bulk so that he can continue working and generating a good income.

loans.use: to buy thread and colored nylon in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 30 years old and lives in Gaza with his wife and five daughters. He works at a government institution and his house was partly destroyed in the recent conflict, so he is requesting a loan for $4,000 to repair and sell it before winter. He is trying very hard to live a normal life, and is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push himself to achieve his goals. Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him secure this loan.

loans.use: to rebuild his house and the walls that were destroyed in the Gaza war

loans.name: Russel Ann

texts.en:
Rusell Ann is married and  lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. 

For over five years, her general store has done well and it provides an income for her family. 

She sells dried fish and grains in addition to her grocery items. She successfully repaid her previous loan to buy some items for her store. She requests  a new loan to purchase feeding supplies, rice and corn grits, and dried fish.
 
In the future, Rusell Ann hopes to improve her business and improve the family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies, rice and corn grits and dried fish in addition to her stocks for sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a smallholder farmer based Kaboi village, located in North Rift region of Kenya. She lives together with her husband and three children on a half-an-acre piece of land where she also keeps dairy cattle and poultry and grows tea and vegetables. She has been doing this work for 13 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea and profits from a personal business.

Jackline is seeking a loan to purchase farm inputs that include cereals. This is in preparation for the rain onset, which will usher in a new season of crop production. She is in need of a loan since farming inputs are very expensive. Farmers' crop income does not come on the regular. They have to wait for an entire season for their harvest in order to generate income. Abundance of harvest is not guaranteed because of the countless factors and uncertainties presented by both the internal and the external environment. Such loans as the one Jackline is seeking help farmers to afford input costs for the next season without having to forego some of their family's basic necessities. 

When asked how this loan will impact her life, she replied, "It will expand my cereals business and elevate my family's livelihood."

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Nahuophou Group

texts.en:
Pai is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water borne diseases. Pai's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in her village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  

Even though some people in the village, including Pai, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Pai and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Pai's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and over all well-being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en: Mwatime is married and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She and her husband own a house that has neither has electricity nor piped-in water. She has operated a fish-selling business for more than three years, and her customers are restaurant operators and passersby. Her major challenges are seasonality and perishability, both of which cause losses. She is requesting a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy bundles of fish to resell. She dreams of expanding this business and establishing a new one in the near future.

loans.use: to buy bundles of fish to resell.

loans.name: Yangkham Group

texts.en:
Thongphun's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.   

Thongphun is excited that they were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. 

The water filter also increases disposable income to users due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, decreased time spent foraging for wood, and decreased  the amount of money used to  purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Khaqani

texts.en:
Khaqani is a 40-years-old married man. His wife is a housekeeper and they have a son. She takes care of him while Khaqani earns money for family. He works as a plumber and additionally repairs new water calculators. He has worked in this business for 3 years and has good skills. His monthly income is 450 AZN.

During the last year many cities and regions of Azerbaijan started to use a new water calculator which works with a smart card. Many people don’t understand this system yet because it’s new and a little bit hard for them to get used to it. Khaqani helps everybody who has question or can’t use this system. Naturally Khaqani is very kind man and always helps everybody who needs help.

Khaqani’s income is to low and doesn’t cover family’s demands. He needs good plumber tools in order to raise his productivity and get more earnings because the old tools don’t help him anymore. He applied for a 600 AZN loan in order to buy new high quality tools and coverall for plumber.

loans.use: to buy new high quality tools and coverall for work as a plumber.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen del Carmen está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, la cual es una zona que aun se encuentra en crecimiento.  Por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Gladys es una de la integrante, ella tiene su pequeño negocio de ventas de Ropas ambulante, desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra prendas varias para la venta, que le permitirá poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por un futuro mejor. Agradecen por la oportunidad que todas reciben.
texts.en:
The "Virgen del Carmen" group is in its first cycle in the women's committee program.  The group is located in the city of Curuguaty, a region that is currently growing.  The members of this group want to fight to continue growing and make the area that they live a better place so that they can continue to grow.

Gladys is one of the members of the group.  She has a small business selling clothing as a street vendor.  She hopes that with time, and through the help of people in her area, they can begin to improve their environment so that they can provide their families with more security and give them a better future.  She is seeking this loan to purchase a variety of clothing to resell.  This will allow her to continue with her sales and to continue fighting for a better future.  They are grateful for this opportunity that they are receiving.

loans.use: purchase a variety of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en: Elmira is 58 years old, married and the mother of two sons. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him raise seasonal fruits and vegetables in their garden, including apples, pears, potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers. She sells this produce in a local bazaar, and has good skills because she has been doing this for four years. Her monthly income is 450 AZN. Elmira benefits from the fact that she lives in an area where there is high demand for fresh fruits and vegetables. Customers buy them year round to make different delicious dishes, or eat them fresh. Recently, the productivity of her garden has fallen because of bad weather. Elmira needs to repair her greenhouse and is requesting a loan for 1,500 AZN loan to hire workers to repair the structure along with other damaged parts of her garden.

loans.use: to hire workers and repair damaged parts of garden.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es: José de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, él se dedica a la elaboración de zapatos desde hace 25 años, su taller está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con la que elabora su trabajo, José está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más material por mayor como: cuero, pegamento, plantillas, suelas, etc. para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: José is 48 years old and lives with his wife and their three children in a house that they own.  For the past 25 years, he has worked making shoes.  His workshop is located in his home.  He has many customers because of the quality of his work.  José is seeking this loan to purchase more material such as: leather, glue, insoles, soles, etc, so that he can continue with his work.

loans.use: purchase glue, insoles, soles, etc...

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la confección prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, agujas, etc. para la elaboración de la ropa y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Dora is 34 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She makes clothes for a living and she works from home. She makes a variety of different items of clothing and sells them at very affordable prices. Her work is of a good quality, which is why many people come to her. She has worked in this field for many years and has a lot of experience as well as loyal customers who keep coming back to her. She has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL in order to invest in her small business and buy key supplies, such as fabric, thread, elastic, needles, and so on, to make clothing and to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, needles, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married and the mother of two children. She is 50 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a fish-selling business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Elizabeth has been in this business for ten years, and her goals for the future are to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nampa Group

texts.en:
Khamxone's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams. The water from natural sources in Khamxone's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. 

Khamxone is excited that he was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter  because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. Even though some people in the village are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. 

Khamxone and other filter users experienced a decrease in the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent searching for firewood. Khamxone's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Keangsadork Group

texts.en:
Viengxai's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Viengxai is excited that he was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal,  decreased time spent searching for wood, and decreased  amount of money used to  purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Kang Group

texts.en:
Khu is excited that he was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water borne diseases. 

Khu's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams. However, the water from natural sources in his village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  Even though some people in the village are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. 

Khu and other filter users experienced a decrease in the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent searching for firewood. 

Khu's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and over all well-being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase woods, nails, glue, varnish, reed and other supplies.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
The agriculture sector accounts for 45% of Kenya's gross domestic product, generates 70% of Kenya’s export revenue, and employs approximately 70% of Kenyans. Despite the importance of agriculture to Kenya and its economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Kenya remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers. 

Meet Nancy, an ever-smiling, hardworking and honest mother who is 28 years of age! She hails from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of 3 lovely, school-going children. She loves and treasures her children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. 

Nancy’s primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 10 years, and throughout she has never regretted going into farming. 

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses". She faces financial challenges, and because the Nandi Hills area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereal for re-sale and thus improve her income. 

Nancy’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. But this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Nancy has received training and proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business.

Nancy is quite visionary and - with her accumulated profits - hopes she will be able to open a large cereal selling shop that will boost her income and completely turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereal for re-sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Leonzo Antonio

texts.es: Leonzo es un joven emprendedor, a su corta edad se graduó de bachiller y maestro de educación primaria con 4 años de laborar, casado, con un hijo a su cargo al que le brinda el apoyo para su desarrollo, actualmente imparte clases en un colegio fuera de la zona donde vive, este joven se presento a Ceprodel para expresar sobre un problema familiar que tiene, tomando la decisión de solicitar financiamiento, el que lo utilizaría en gastos personales y de esa manera mejorar las con diciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Leonzo is an enterprising young man. At his young age he graduated with a bachelors degree, and he is a primary school teacher with 4 years of experience. He is married, with a son under his charge. Currently, he teaches at a school outside the area where he lives. This young man came to Ceprodel to talk about a family problem he has, and made the decision to request a loan which he will use for personal expenses and in this way improve his situation and level of life.

loans.use: to pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Maria Lilian

texts.es: Maria vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes porque vende una variedad de productos y a buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Maria solicita un crédito para la compra de sopa, detergentes, granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, etc. para tener más productos y así tener mejores ganancias
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own house with her family group.  She has a shop located in her residence.  She has lots of customers because she sells a variety of products and at good prices.  With what she obtains from her sales, she is able to cover some of the household expenses. 
Maria is requesting a credit to buy soup, detergents, basic grains, candies, soft drinks, etc. in order to have more products and thus have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy soup, detergents, basic grains, candies, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, but she also earns additional income from tailoring. Gloria is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladys de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y sus dos nietas, ella posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su hija logran salir adelante con los gastos que se les presentan, Gladys esta solicitando un crédito para comprar: granos básicos, sopas, refrescos, golosinas, café, huevos, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Gladys, 46, lives in her own house with her daughter and her two grand-daughters.  She has had a shop in her place of residence for 15 years.  She has many customers.  With what she obtains from her sales and with the help of her daughter, they are able to come out ahead with the expenses as they present themselves.  
Gladys is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, soups, soft drinks, candies, coffee, eggs, etc. and thus be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soups, soft drinks, candies, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Reina Gloria

texts.es: Reina vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de su ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, huevos, etc. y así surtir la tienda y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Reina lives in her own house with her family group.  She has had a little shop located in her place of residence for several years.  With what she obtains from her sales, she is able to cover some of the household expenses.  
She is requesting a loan in order to buy soups, basic grains, candies, soft drinks, eggs, etc. and thus stock the shop and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy soups, basic grains, candies, soft drinks, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es: Justa de 67 años de edad, es una mujer vuda, madre de 3 hijos, hoy en edades adultas. Desde hace 6 años, inició su negocio de restaurante, atendiendo a su buen gusto por la comida y que siempre le gustó la cocina. Por eso organizó un local y emprndió su idea de negocios, en el cual le ha ido muy bien que hasta genera 3 empleos, pues tiene 3 trabajadores. Justa siempre los cuales apoyar a sus hijos, lo cual hoy es aun  su meta. El restaurante tiene clientes fijos, pero necesita fortalecerlo, para que su negocio se convierta en una empresa familiar, que motive a todos. En la actualidad Justa está aplicando a un credikiva,primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas, como víveres, aderezos etc, con el fin de incrementar su productividad y obtener muchas mas ganancias, lo cual hace de su credito una buena inversión.
texts.en: Justa, 67 years old, is a widow, mother of 3 children, who are now adults. Six years ago, she opened her restaurant business, taking into account her good taste for food and that she has always liked cooking. For this reason, she organized a location and undertook her business idea, which has gone very well, even to the point of creating 3 jobs, since she has 3 employees. Justa always does what she can to support her children, and today it is still her goal.  The restaurant has a steady customer base, but she needs to strengthen it, so that it becomes a family business, which motivates everyone. Currently, Justa is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase raw materials such as groceries and seasonings, etc. with the end of increasing her productivity and getting much more income, which will make her loan a good investment.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as groceries and seasonings, etc.

loans.name: Edin Orlando

texts.es:
Edin es un joven de 24 años de edad,humildemente vive con sus padres quienes le han apoyado incondicionalmente a lo largo de su vida para que el pueda lograr sus metas y alcanzar sus sueños, en donde el mayor de estos es poder terminar sus estudios universitarios.
Desde muy pequeño le ha ayudado a su padre en su negocio de vidriería,que con mucho esfuerzo han logrado establecer desde hace algunos años, para poder generar un ingreso económico y mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar, actualmente la situación económica del país le ha afectado a su padre en el proceso de negociación con sus clientes lo que ha producido ventas muy bajas y resultados poco favorables para apoyarlo en sus estudios universitarios, es por eso que el joven decididamente ha tomado la alternativa solicitado un crédito para estudiar y así poder continuar con sus estudios.
Edin se considera un joven de muchas aspiraciones en la vida, es servicial y colaborador con las personas que están a su alrededor, es luchador le gusta el trabajo y sobre todo obedecer a sus padres.
Su motivo mas grande para continuar con sus estudios, es su familia ya que gracias a ellos es un hombre emprendedor y de sueños por alcanzar.
Piensa que la mejor forma de contribuir al desarrollo de su país es poder brindar un servicio a las demás persona, apoyar mediante sus conocimientos y habilidades y a la familia desea contribuir mediante una generación de ingresos económicos.
Hoy en día agradece a Dios la oportunidad de estar en familia y luchar juntos para mejorar sus vidas. tiene la aspiración de ser un empresario que pueda brindar la oportunidad de un empleo.
texts.en:
Edin is a 24-year-old man and lives with his parents in simple conditions. His parents have supported him unconditionally for all of his live, so that he could achieve his goals and realize his dreams. His biggest dream is to be able to complete his studies at university.

Since Edin was very young, he has helped his father in his glassworks business, which they managed to grow with a lot of effort over the last few years. This business provides them with economic means and improves the living conditions of the family. At the moment, the economic situation in the country has affected his father's negotiations with his customers, and therefore sales have plunged. As a result, to assist Edin with his studies has become difficult, and for this reason Edin has decided to ask for a loan as an alternative way to be able to continue his studies.

Edin considers himself to be a young man with many plans for his life. He is very obliging and cooperative in his relationships with others. He is tenacious, he likes to work, and, above all, to please his parents. His main motive to continue his studies is his family, because, thanks to them, he is an enterprising young man with dreams he wants to fulfill. 

He thinks that the best way to contribute to the development of his country is to be able to offer services to other people, to help them with his knowledge and his abilities, and he wants to help his family by providing the necessary income for the household. 

"Today, he thanks God for the opportunity to be together with his family and to strive together to improve their lives."

His dream is to become a businessman who can offer employment opportunities to others.

loans.use: to complete his university studies.

loans.name: Newis

texts.es: En el mes de Enero del año 2004, Newis, una mujer de 35 años de edad,madre de 4 hijos en las edades de 1 a 20 años. emprendió su generador de ingresos, apoyándose en su experiencia obtenida en una peluquería en la cual trabajaba como empleada y también cuando había perfeccionado su tarea con estudios en escuelas técnicas especializadas. Hoy ofrece el servicio de mejoramiento personal y profesional, mediante peinados, tintura de cabello, corte y aliser, sus clientes como la conocen en el sector, llegan a su local ubicado en el lugar donde habita y a ellos le ofrece la oportunidad de acceder a sus productos a crédito y de contado. Sus compras las realiza en distribuidores mayoristas que le ofrecen buenos precios y puede así ser mas competitivo. Newis tiene una meta mas adelante, que es la de remodelar y ampliar su local, pues su mayor desafío es fidelizar su clientela e incrementar sus ventas. Esta última es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  Productos capilares, tintes, champú y keratina. Con esta inversión incrementará sus ventas y obtendrá mayores utilidades, lo cual es  el éxito  e su inversión.
texts.en:
Newis, a 35-year-old woman with four children ranging in age from 1 to 20, started her income-generating business in January 2004 using the experience she gained working as an employee in a hair salon and her knowledge from studying in specialized technical schools.  

Today she offers professional personal improvement services by doing hair styling, dying, cutting, and straightening. Since her clients are familiar with her services, they come to her shop which is located in her house.  She offers them the option of paying with cash or on credit. Newis buys her supplies from wholesalers who offer good prices, allowing her to be more competitive. 

Newis' future goal is to remodel and expand her shop, but her biggest challenge is to retain her clientele and to increase sales. The latter is the reason why she is asking for a Kiva loan, the first she is doing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy hair products such as dyes, shampoo, and keratin. This investment will lead to increased sales and greater profits, making the investment a success.

loans.use: to buy hair products, dyes, shampoo and keratin.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy  more ready-to-wear stock, such as pants, T-shirts and dresses

loans.name: Zaib Un Nisa

texts.en:
Zaib un Nisa is 30 years old and the mother of two children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly and he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Zaib un Nisa has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Zaib un Nisa is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repair costs for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassa, who is 25 years old,  lives with his wife and son in Gaza. He has been working as an employee at a government institution, and is one of the  people affected by the last war in Gaza.

Hassa's house was partly destroyed, so he has applied for a loan to rebuild the bathroom and kitchen and repaint the house. He hopes to be able provide his son the best life conditions possible,  and is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to rebuild the bathroom and kitchen and repaint the house.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranic, 22, lives separately from his parents with his wife. He is trying to establish his farm with the farming skills he learned from his father. He also works at a construction company as a labourer. His wife has a small clothes-trading business, which she organizes from their house. 

For this nice couple, the main and most important aim is to establish a farm, take care of it and build it with the passage of time. Andranik now has a cow, a calf, a piglet and 10 chickens. As he likes to say, these few cattle are a real wealth for him, and he dreams of increasing the number. 

Currently, his farm products include milk, meat and eggs. He hardly manages to sell any of his products and also use them for his family, but this problem can be solved by increasing his number of cattle.

For this reason, Andranik is asking for a loan of 350,000 Armenian drams to buy two bulls and animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two bulls and animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a woman eager to get ahead. She is 64 years old and lives with her husband in the Nandihills area of Kenya. She is blessed with seven children who are her greatest motivation in life to persevere, because she wants to provide for them a better future. 

Gladys was unable to study to have a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. Gladys always says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.” 

Because of how much she likes farming she has even nicknamed one of her cows “Kijana ” which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows, which produce between 10-15 liters a day; this helps her support her family. 

Karimi also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements. That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to puchase high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Gladys is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production over the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Gladys believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her child a solid educational background. This loan will be Gladys' way out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah, a 39-year-old married mother of three, has had a grocery business in the town of Machakos for four years now. She will use this loan to buy more stocks of mangoes, cabbages and pawpaws to sell. The anticipated profits will be directed toward her children's education.

This is Serah's first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and in future she hopes to have a prosperous business and a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell

loans.name: Silvia Santos

texts.es: Silvia de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, lo hace de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad de la ropa, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Silvia, who is 62 years old, lives in her own house with her life companion. She sells secondhand clothing. She does it as a street vendor in various markets. She has many customers because of the quality of the clothing. She is applying for a loan to buy clothing wholesale, since this is her only source of work and thus she will be able to have better income.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, metal sheets, iron, sand, ceramic tile, etc., and pay for labor to complete the construction of some rooms in her house.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Rafael de 45 años de edad trabaja como agricultor con lo que obtiene en su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de poner las puertas y ventanas en donde  muestra  la fotografía pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para comprar laminas, vidrios, balcones, etc. y pago de mano de obra y asi poder terminar su casa y que el y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: Rafael, who is 45 years old, works as a farmer. With what he obtains from his work, he manages to pay for the expenses that arise in his household. He lives in his own house with his wife and their four children. He wants to improve his home by completing the installation of the doors and windows in the part shown in the photograph, but what he earns doesn't go far enough to do it. For this reason, he is applying for a loan to buy metal sheeting, glass, balconies, etc., and pay for labor and thus be able to finish his house so that he and his family can live more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, glass, balconies, etc., and pay for labor to finish building his house

loans.name: Narzinisa

texts.ru: Нарзиниса, 49 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Нарзинисы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается выпечкой лепешек, с молодости помогала свекру, так и сама научилась. Собственный бизнес начала в 1996 году и развила его. Для производства лепешек есть тандыр, столы, Нарзиниса для выпечки использует уголь, а не дрова, заботясь таким образом об экологии. На сегодняшний день ежемесячный доход Нарзинисы составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). Она сама реализует лепешки на местном рынке, горячие и очень вкусные они пользуются большим спросом, есть постоянные клиенты. Также в хозяйстве есть 1 корова и 8 овец. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку муки и угля для выпечки лепешек. Доходы от кредита Нарзиниса планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, она мечтает построить большой лепешечный цех.
texts.en: Narzinisa is 49 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has a secondary level education.  She makes a living by baking pastries, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income and which she learned when she was young, by helping her mother-in-law.  Narzinisa started her own business in 1996 and she has developed it since then.  She has a tandoor oven, some tables, and she uses coal, as opposed to wood, as she cares about the environment.  She currently makes a monthly income of 16,000 som (KGS).  She sells her pastries herself at the local market and they are so hot and delicious that she receives a high demand for them from regular customers.  Narzinisa also owns one cow and eight sheep.  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) which will allow her to buy flour and coal for baking.  She plans to use the profits from her loan to further develop her business and to build a large bakery shop.

loans.use: to purchase flour and coal to bake Kyrgyz traditional pastries.

loans.name: Yolanda Veronica

texts.es: Yolanda de 36 años de edad vive con sus padres, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 3 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda a   solventar los gastos de su hogar. Yolanda solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Yolanda, who is 36 years old, lives with her parents. She has had a beauty salon business in her place of residence for three years. She works from 9:00 am to 7:00 pm. She has many customers, since she works very well. With the earnings that she obtains, she helps to pay the household expenses. Yolanda is applying for a loan to be able to buy products for her beauty salon, such as creams, shampoo, hairpins, and scissors, among other items that she needs. Thus she will be able to obtain better earnings that will help her to have a more stable economy.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hairpins, and scissors, among other items.

loans.name: Wilber Rodolfo

texts.es: Wilber vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas y su compañera de vida, él se dedica desde hace 4 años al cultivo de maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, con lo que obtiene logra solventar los gastos del hogar, Wilber esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semilla, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografia para continuar con sus siembras y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Wilber lives in his own house with his two daughters and his life companion. He has worked for four years raising corn. He sells his products in various markets. With what he obtains, he manages to pay the household expenses. Wilber is applying for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph in order to continue with his plantings and thus have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soups, detergents, basic grains, candies, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Leilanie

texts.en: Leilanie has been helping her husband work on their own farm to make a living. Farming is their main source of income. In addition, she has been engaged in more businesses to earn a decent income for the family. She has been operating a transportation service business and a fishing business. Her previous loans have been repaid successfully because she has managed her business activities well. Recently, she took a new loan to buy fishing nets and pay maintenance costs for repairing their fishing boat to go fishing safely. She wants an improvement to her business as well as the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to redecorate and buy some new tools for his barber shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plates, glasses, cups, pots, frying pans, etc., wholesale

loans.name: Aracely Guadalupe

texts.es: Arecely de 51 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, su negocio se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee mucha clientela, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa y zapatos por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Aracely, who is 51 years old, sells clothing and shoes. Her business is located near her place of residence in a very busy zone. For this reason, she has many customers. She lives in her own house with her family group. She is applying for a loan to purchase clothing and shoes wholesale, since this is her only source of work, and thus she will be able to have better income.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes wholesale

loans.name: Jenna Rose

texts.en:
Jenna Rose, 29, has been engaged in selling fish for more than four years now. She is a married woman with two children ages 8 and 6 years old, respectively. Jenna Rose is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of fish. This will enable her to sell more fish and eventually gain a higher yield, provide her family with nutritious food and good living conditions and be able to continue to send her children to school.

In the future, Jenna Rose hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fish

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is 35 years old  She is a housewife and looks after her family consists of five persons. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides services in stitching to people at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching material for her stitching work, including threads, needles, cloth, etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Jamila is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan as per her requirement. Jamila is very thankful to Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials

loans.name: Blanca Reina

texts.es: Blanca de 54 años de edad trabaja vendiendo minutas por las diferentes colonias con lo que obtiene en su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su madre y su hermana, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo una pared donde  muestra  la fotografía pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para comprar cemento, ladrillos, arena, hierro, etc. y pago de mano de obra y asi poder terminar su casa y asi puedan vivir mas seguras.
texts.en: Bianca, who is 54 years old, sells shaved ice snacks in various neighborhoods. With what she obtains from her work, she manages to pay the expenses that arise in her household. She lives in her own house with her mother and her sister. She wants to improve her house by constructing a wall in the place shown in the photograph, but what she earns doesn't go far enough to do it. For this reason she is applying for a loan to purchase cement, bricks, sand, iron, etc., and pay for labor, and thus she will be able to finish her house and they will be able to live more securely.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, iron, etc., and pay for labor to build a wall

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena, age 45, is a mother of four children. Her son owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including threads, needles, cloth, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his mother Zareena is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her son. He will purchase the needed things with the help of the loan. Zareena is feeling happy that she will be able to help her son with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her son's tailoring work

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Meet Margaret, 55, a smallholder dairy farmer based in Kisii, Kenya. She has four lovely children (three cute boys and one adorable girl). She has been doing dairy farming for seven years now. Her primary source of income is milk, eggs, tea and veggies. Margaret is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo for paying for poultry. This venture will diversify her product portfolio and help her manage risks that may affect a single product line. With poultry, she will be able to sell eggs and other poultry products in the market to boost her income. The money will help her manage to pay the high costs of inputs that have given her sleepless nights in the past. She loves farming and she aspires to keep growing her business. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo and its partners for being supportive to smallholder farmers and making financial loans to farmers affordable. She plans to keep leveraging her business to grow her farm and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Jacider

texts.en:
Jacider is a farmer in Machakos town, where she grows cash crops to sell. She has been running this business for five years now. She is 37 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children. She also has a beauty salon business.

She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting as well as salon materials such as blow dryers, hair chemicals and hair oil too. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future she hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and beauty salon equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soup, detergents, basic grains, candies, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es: Anabel vive en casa propia desde hace varios años posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes porque vende una variedad de productos y a buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella solicita un crédito para la compra de sopa, detergentes, granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, etc. para tener más productos y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Anabel lives in her own house. For a number of years she has had a store located in her place of residence. She has many customers because she sells a variety of products at good prices. With what she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay some of her household expenses. She lives in her own house with her family group. She is applying for a loan to purchase soups, detergents, basic grains, candies, soft drinks, etc., in order to have more products and thus have better income.

loans.use: to buy soups, detergents, basic grains, candies, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en: Lan is 49 years old and lives with two sons and her husband. For the past 5 years Lan has been running a general store from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a 5-member loan group that live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is in the second from left wearing a blue blouse. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Lan is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of products such as food and beverages to restock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy products such as food and beverages for selling from her general store.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 35 year lives in Gaza, with his wife and their three children. His wife is unemployed and the kids are completing their middle school studies. His house was damaged by the last war at Gaza.
The goal of the loan will be to buy construction tools and to be able pay for the workers, since these are important for him to mend the damages. He wants to rebuild the ceiling and the windows.
One of his biggest dreams is to see his children grow and to give them an education so that they can become professionals. Jihad is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to buy construction tools and pay for repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a cow shed.

loans.name: Zyinagul

texts.ru: Зыйнагул, 59 лет, разведена, 3 детей. У Зыйнагул средне-специальное медицинское образование, она фельдшер. С 2009 года Зыйнагул занимается полеводством и животноводством. Она арендует земельные наделы для выращивания и заготовки сена и корма для скота. В хозяйстве Зыйнагул есть 2 коровы и 10 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль в хороший сезон составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зыйнагул обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков, часть средств, а именно 30,000 сом (KGS) Зыйнагул планирует инвестировать в открытие мебельного магазина для ее сына. Доходы от кредита Зыйнагул будет откладывать на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Zyinagul is 59, divorced, and has three children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education with some vocational training in medicine as a mid-level practitioner.  Since 2009, she has been growing crops and raising livestock.  She rents some land to grow hay and other fodder for her animals, which currently amount to two cows and ten sheep, and her monthly income is nearly 15,000 som if she's having a good season.  

To further develop her farm and help her son start his own business, Zyinagul is seeking a loan of 100,000 som; 30,000 will allow her son to open his own furniture store, and the rest will go towards four new bull calves for her farm.  In addition, she'll use her increased income due to the loan to set aside money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: buy four bull calves and help her son open his own furniture store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cheese, meats, dairy products, cold meats, and disposable products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build the kitchen again, install pipelines and windows.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children and all go to school. She takes care of two additional family members. She sells secondhand clothes on a retail basis. She moves door to door to sell her products. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last six years. 

She has requested a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to put up a permanent business premises. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is 48 years old, and lives with his wife and seven children in Gaza. He is selling paint stuff. His family was affected by the last war in Gaza, and his house was partly destroyed. So he has applied for a loan to rebuild the bathroom and kitchen, paint, and install windows for the house again. He put covers on the house windows until he can install windows. He hopes to be able provide his children the best living conditions. 

He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to paint, rebuild the bathroom and kitchen, and install windows for his house again.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
While many young people in Africa dream of getting well-paying jobs, Salma, from the Nandi hills area of Kenya, left her “peanuts” paying job to become a full-time small holder farmer. She decided that she will be independent and contribute to her community by practicing mixed farming. Salma is married and blessed with three lovely children (two boys and one girl) who she refers to as “my heart beat.” Her primary sources of income are milk selling, poultry farming, and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income. Deciding to practice poultry farming for Salma was not difficult. “I was brought up with chickens raised by my grandfather and grandmother,” Salma said. “It is in my blood.” For the past five years, Salma has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase her poultry, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. 

Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunity for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Salma is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Salma is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Maria, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Nandi hills area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley escarpment. 

Maria, 27, has been farming for the past eight years. Through these years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, tea, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. 

Maria is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. 

Kenya's Nandi hills area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Maria could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Maria, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. 

Maria believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Maria to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy cereals to resell

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en:
Joweria is a married  mother of five children, and two of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of owing a fully stocked stall and also to buy a plot of land and build a house.

She resides in her own house, and the family has electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Tawfeeq

texts.en:
Tawfeeq is 39 years old and lives with his wife, his two sons and one daughter in Gaza. He has been working at a service office for students. 

He is one of the affected people from the last war in Gaza. His house was fully destroyed, and he would like to repair it again, but he lost all his property, so he is trying now to take the first step until he can get back to his normal life. 

For these reasons, he has requested a loan from Ryada to purchase cement and other building materials and also pay for the worker to start working at rebuilding. 

Tawfeeq is very grateful to everyone who helps him. He hopes to be able to be back to his normal life again with his family, and to provide good living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to purchase cement and other building materials, install doors and windows, and rebuild the walls.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 25-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives alone in a small simple house. Four years ago, Yousef opened his own business, which is a sewing workshop using a room in his house. It is a good business and he takes a lot of orders from the local traders. 

Yousef requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new sewing machine for his workshop. by taking this loan, Yousef will be able to improve his work quality.
 
Yousef appears in the photo in his sewing workshop

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for his workshop.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en: Syuzanna works as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature at a school in her native city of Vanadzor in the Lori region. She has higher pedagogical education and 15 years of working experience in this field. She is a beloved teacher and respected pedagogue among her collogues and her pupils as well. She also gives private paid courses at her house, during which she helps the pupils prepare for the entrance examinations. Syuzanna is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband is an engineer and he works at a factory. Syuzanna would like to buy a computer, printer and professional literature with this loan, which will surely make her lessons more interesting and colorful for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer, printer and professional literature

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc would like to take a further loan to buy animal feed to raise pigs. Ngoc's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy animal feed to raise pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle accessories like piston rings, nuts, bolts and additional stock like perfume, soap and lotion

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Wonderful Kiva Lenders! Meet Hellen, a dedicated, determined and honest mother of five lovely children. She is based in Nandi hills, Kenya. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest tea growing regions. For the past 5 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, tea and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed her earn a decent income. Hellen passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made her give up “I have to do something for my family and children,” she said. She mobilized other enterprising woman like her in her village and they have joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance that assists small-scale farmers through giving out loans and training. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi kilimo via Kiva lender to buy additional poultry. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money. Through this loan, Hellen will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her poultry business.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Gam

texts.en: Gam, 42, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two daughters, one son and her husband. Her husband works for an environmental sanitation company. Gam earns money through her business selling fruit juice and other beverages. Gam would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of beverages to sell and meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Kwembe Mpakani Group

texts.en:
Anita, who is in her mid 30s, is single with one son who is still going to school.  She has been running two projects:  a pharmacy and a cosmetics business for two years now.  She works from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make small monthly profit. 

This will be Anita's  first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy the out of stock medicines in her pharmacy. She dreams of making her pharmacy international.

Anita will share this loan with her loan group "KWEMBE MPAKANI", which consist of 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy medicines that are out of stock in her pharmacy.

loans.name: Shiruya

texts.en: Shiruya is a smart young woman. She is not married and lives with her father. Shiruya is a student in her third course. She studies at the National University of Tajikistan. Shiruya studies Eastern languages. She wants to be a translator after graduating from  the university. Shiruya studies well. She is one of the best students. She must pay for her tuition but does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is married with two children, and both go to school. She has additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for five years. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more charcoal for sale. She works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of increasing her loan amounts so as to serve her customers better.   

She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ehson

texts.en:
Ehson lives with his parents in the capital of Tajikistan. He is a student. Ehson studies at the faculty of programming at Tajikistan Technology University. He is a student of the second course. 

Ehson studies well. He always reads books, magazines and newspapers. He dreams to work in any bank after graduating university. 

Ehson is asking for a loan of $1,025 USD to pay for tuition. His parents have not the opportunity to pay for his tuition. So, he really needs your support. He awaits your help.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Rafaat

texts.en:
Rafaat is a 21-year-old university student majoring in air conditioning and heaters engineering. He also works in the evening in transporting goods using a truck he has. His father is a retired man.
