Rafaat is a single, self-dependent young man who is seeking to get his Bachelor's to find a job in his field after graduating. Because of the financial crisis he has been facing, he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that purpose, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Umaya

texts.en:
Umaya is a 22-year-old university student majoring in microbiology, and she is in her third year. She lives with her family that consists of five members. She also works in the evening at an exporting and importing company. 

Umaya is seeking to find a job with a better income and in her study field after getting her Bachelor's, but she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en:
Leyla is 35 years old. She is married with a child. Her child’s name is Camil and he is age 10. Camil goes to fourth class. 

Leyla and her husband have been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) for 22 years from Fuzuli city, and now they are living in Seyidahmadli village of the Fuzuli region.  

Leyla has been in an animal-breeding business for 12 years. Today, for the support of her business, Leyla needs a loan in the amount of 2,100 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). With this amount she is planning to buy two cows.  

Leyla says she is thankful to the Kiva organization for the help and support. In the future, she wants to build a new stall for the cows.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal PITUSIRAY,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca ,provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio tiene 63 años de edad y es conviviente, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a ejercer su carrera de docente en uno de los colegios de la zona, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres y un electrodoméstico para su casa.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs the "Pitusiray" communal bank, located in Calca district, Calca province in Cusco department.

He is 63 years old and lives with his partner. He alternates his daily activities by working as a teacher in one of the area schools. He has been doing his work for a considerable time, and it is going well thanks to the effort that he puts into his job each day. He wants to be able to continue working so that he can continue supporting his family. 

He is requesting the loan in order to purchase supplies and a home appliance. He is grateful for the loan granted and promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: To buy supplies and a home appliance.

loans.name: Rakiétou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de poisons fumés à SOKODE depuis 2004, Rakiétou vit avec sa famille(mari et 03 enfants) dans la même localité. cette activité qu'elle mène lui procure des revenus lui permettant de contribuer aux charges familiales. N'arrivant plus à servir ses clients comme elle le souhaite, Rakiétou fait sa quatrième demande pour acheter des marchandises. Comme perspectives d'avenir, elle espère agrandir en vendant en gros et contribuer à l'épanouissement de la famille. Elle est âgée de 32ans.
texts.en:
A retail merchant of smoked fish in Sokode since 2004, Rakiétou lives in the same locality with her family (husband and three children).

Her business activity provides income enabling her to contribute towards family expenses. No longer able to serve her customers as she would like to, Rakiétou is requesting her fourth loan to purchase merchandise.

In the future she hopes to expand into wholesaling and contribute to her family's development. She is 32 years old.

loans.use: buy smoked fish

loans.name: America Libertad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal PITUSIRAY,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca ,provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 24 años de edad es casada y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a ejercer su carrera de docente en uno de los colegios de la zona, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia a la vez se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank PITUSIRAY which is located in the district and province of Calca in the department of Cusco.  She is 24 years old, married and has a son, and alternates her daily activities with a teaching position at one of the schools in the area.  For quite some time she has been working and thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day it is going well for her.  She also sells clothing and wants to continue working to support her family.

The loan requested by the member is to buy jackets for her business.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy jackets for her business.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal PITUSIRAY,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca ,provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Jacqueline tiene 30 años de edad es soltera y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a ejercer su carrera de docente en uno de los colegios de la zona, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales didácticos  parta su aula.
La socia se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank PITUSIRAY which is located in the district and province of Calca in the department of Cusco. Jacqueline is 24 years old, has a son, and alternates her daily activities with a teaching position at one of the schools in the area. For quite some time she has been working and thanks to the hard work she puts in every day, it is going well for her. She is responsible and hard-working in order to support her family.

Jacqueline is requesting a loan to buy teaching materials for her classroom.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy teaching materials for her classroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tomatoes, chilis, carrots, onions, cabbage and pork meat to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Barrio Nuevo Group

texts.es: Orbin, tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y tiene un hijo, reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Orbin siempre se ha dedicado a cultivar maíz y frijoles y hace 7 años decidió sembrar café, este cultivo le genera mejores ingresos para su familia. El café que produce lo vende en la misma zona. El esta solicitando un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras que es en forma grupal para mejorar su finca de café. invertirá en la compra de abonos, foliares e insumos para aplicarle a su cultivo y sacar mayor producción. Su meta es tener una familia digna, crecer en la caficultura y ser un productor fuerte de la zona. El grupo se llama Barrio Nuevo, integrado por tres personas que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican al cultivo de café. El préstamo grupal es por 13,000 Lempiras y lo invertirán en la fertilización de la finca de café. En la foto se identifica Orbin a la izquierda, Elvia y Marlin a la derecha.
texts.en:
Orbin is 27 years old, single and has one son. Orbin lives in a village that is part of the Gracias municiaplity of Lempira. Orbin has always worked growing corn and beans and seven years ago he decided to start growing coffee. This crops earns him a higher income for his family. Orbin produces and sells the coffee in the same area.

As part of a group loan, Orbin is applying for a loan of 5000 Lempira in order to improve his coffee farm. He will use it to buy manure, fertilisers and supplies for coffee crops and to increase his yield. Orbin's goals are to give his family a decent life, to expand his coffee-growing business and to be a good coffee producer in the area. 

This group is called "Barrio Nuevo" and has three members who live in the same community and who grow coffee. This group loan of 13,000 Lempira will be invested in fertilisers for coffee crops. In the photo, from left to right, are Orbin, Elvia and Marlin.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilisers and supplies for coffee crops.

loans.name: Fenekasi

texts.en: Fenekasi lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He has got a general merchandise shop that sells soap and sugar. He is challenged by price fluctuation. He wants a loan to buy land to practice farming.

loans.use: to buy land to practice farming.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is the age of 38; she is the mother of four children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a dairy farm for five years and generating income for his family. He sells milk to retailers and to the people of his community. He gets milk two times in a day, and his wife and daughters produce cheese, yogurt and butter from the milk. With the addition of these productions he earns sufficient income to run a house.
 
In this time he wants to build a new cow shed for his cattle because the old cow shed is in very poor condition. He does not have enough cash in hand to maintain the cow shed and buy fodder to feed his cattle. Therefore, Yasmeen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can build a cow shed and could easily continue his business. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to build a new cow shed.

loans.name: Kibwe C O U Group

texts.en: Joseph is 40 years old and married with four children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda and is a member of the Kibwe Church of Uganda Group. He operates a retail shop of general merchandise and has been in that business for six years. He began the business to earn income for the family. Limited capital and price fluctuations are his major challenges. Joseph has a dream of expanding his business and making more profits. Joseph appreciates Kiva for the good work it does. Joseph wants a loan to buy cassava flour, rice, sugar and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, rice, sugar and beans for resale.

loans.name: Reham

texts.en: Reham is a 21-year-old young lady living with her family, which consists of eight members, in Irbid, Jordan. She is a university student majoring in Office and Information Management, and she is in her second year. Reham is applying for this loan to help her pay for her upcoming semester fees because she doesn't have enough money to do so. This will make her closer to reaching her aim of getting her Bachelors so she can work in her field of study.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Nelly from the Nandi hills area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. Nelly is 32 years old and a proud mother of two lovely angel-looking children whom she really adores and cherishes. Other than doing domestic chores, Nelly is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past six years and has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Nelly practices mixed farming. That is, she grows tea and keeps dairy cows and, through these, she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed her cow “Lelmet." She really enjoys taking care of her animals. 

Although Nelly has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious woman. Her farm has not been producing as much harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan of  30,000 KES to be able to buy farm implements. Through the loan, Nelly will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate to more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, Nelly will reap more, which will assure her of comfortably taking care of her family and repaying the loan. Nelly’s plan is to be able to increase her farming and to be able to save more money so that she can buy more land for farming.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Leo

texts.en: Leo is a 59-year-old hardworking married man with six children aged 14, 12, 10, 8, 6 and 4. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in banana and coffee planting and selling as his main source of income. He also raises goats to earn extra income. He started these businesses with the intention of earning a living and improving his standard of living. Leo hopes to expand his businesses and have educated children. He faces challenges of pests and diseases and the lack of capital to meet increasing demands. He is requesting a loan to buy manure for his banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy manure for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 48-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw business for the last five years. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly so he has been unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Shehnaz is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repair cost for her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Joseph.  He is married and has two children who are 7 and 5 years old. In 2001, Joseph established his patent medicine business. He began his business because he needed to create employment for himself and to provide a livelihood for his family. Working seven days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Joseph requires a loan in order to purchase medicines. He hopes that this loan will enable him to strengthen his business and to increase his monthly profits by approximately 500,000 SLL. In the future, Joseph plans to become an importer of medicines and to educate his children. He is working toward more funding as he requires more capital to achieve his dreams. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase medicines.

loans.name: Domitila Violeta

texts.es:
Domitila Violeta, vive con hija, en casa propia. Aproximadamente desde hace más de 20 años. Ella cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Su familia es muy unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Domitila Violeta se dedica a la venta de animales menores y a la venta de soya en el distrito de Cayaltí. Desde hace más de 05 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de animales y alimentación balanceado de engorde para los animales. El cual incrementarán su stock y variedad de animales y eso se reflejará al momento de las ventas dado que podrá cumplir con los diferentes gustos y preferencias de su público consumidor por el cual aumentarán sus ventas aumentando sus ingresos, mejorando sus ganancias y por ende prodrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Domitila Violeta has lived with her daughter in her own home for more than 20 years. She has good personal and professional references from her neighbors. Her family is very united. She lives in a community that makes a living from trade, agriculture and animal husbandry. Said community is located in the Cayalti district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru.

Domitila Violeta has made a living selling young animals and soy in the Cayalti district for more than 5 years. The purpose of the loan is to buy animals and balanced feed for fattening the animals. This would increase her stock and the variety of animals and that will return at the moment of the sales given that she can fulfill the different tastes and preferences of her consuming public. This would increase her sales, increasing her income, improving her earnings and will consequently improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and balanced feed for fattening the animals.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is 49 years old. She is a mother of five children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, and other items. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. Some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a measured tone that is impressive and easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is well known in the town; that is the reason his business is going well. 

Due to good relations with his customers, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to meet the demand. Therefore, Najma has requested a loan for her son so that he can buy more stocks of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, and other items. Najma hopes that her son will utilize the loan in a positive way. This amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family. Najma thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her son's general store

loans.name: Sahaddin

texts.en: Sahaddin is 27 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the city of Fuzuli, now living in the village of Dilagarda in the Fuzuli region. He is married with a child. After his military service, he decided  to continue the family business, and since then he has been in the animal breeding business. Sahaddin needs a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN to purchase vaccinations for his animals. Sahaddin wants to increase his business and monthly income. He says thanks to Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase vaccinations for his animals

loans.name: Matiko

texts.en:
Matiko is 41 years old, married and, together with his spouse, has been blessed with four children. He does livestock trading and has been in this business for seven years. 

He will be using this loan to buy more stocks of goats for trading. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

This is his third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He repaid his previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to grow his business, to make more income and to prosper in life.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 38 years old. She is a mother of two children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, and other items. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. Some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a measured tone that is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is well known in the town; that is the reason his business is doing well. 

Due to good relations with his customers, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to meet the demand. Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stocks of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, and other items. Shazia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's general store

loans.name: Carmen Otilia

texts.es:
Carmen Otilia tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, con dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, vive en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Carmen Otilia se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral tales como patos, gallinas, pavos, cuyes, hace 8 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; ella desea invertir en su negocio comprando patos, gallinas, pavos, cuyes, dado que desea aumentar y diversificar su stock de animales; el préstamo le ayudara para tener una mayor diversidad de animales esto can la finalidad de incrementar su productividad de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen Otilia is 49 years old. She is married and is raising two daughters. She lives in her own house in a rural area of the district of  Oyotún, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru. Her community is basically dedicated to agriculture, ranching and commerce. 

Carmen Otilia raises and has sold small animals such as ducks, chickens, turkeys, and guinea pigs for 8 years. Her business is located behind her house. She is asking for the loan for working capital. She wants to invest in buying ducks, chickens, turkeys, and guinea pigs. She wants to increase and diversify her animal stock. The loan will help her to have a more diversity of animals so that she may increase productivity with them and fill her customers' needs.

loans.use: get working capital. She wants to invest in her business by buying ducks, chickens, turkeys, and guinea pigs to increase and diversify her animal stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do maintenance and repair on his motorcycle for work.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix es un hombre de 38 años de edad, casado, padre de dos hijos de 16 y 9 años y su negocio es la pesca.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, constante, paciente, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Cachilaya’ que se encuentra a orillas del lago Titicaca; ubicada en la eco-región del Altiplano Boliviano, el clima en esta región es frío, y los rayos solares muy fuertes.
Felix es de tez morena, estatura mediana, complexión robusta, cabello corto negro, su lengua materna es el aymara y conoce el español. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en el lago Titicaca, esta actividad es un complemento a la vida agropecuaria familiar a la que están acostumbrados y contribuye al ingreso familiar, empleo y mejor alimentación de su familia
Su sueño es mejorar los ingresos económicos para su familia, él desea realizar la compra de redes de pesca y refaccionar su bote para mayor seguridad.
Es por esos motivos que Felix solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pesca y refacción de su bote.
texts.en:
Felix is a 38 year old man who is married and the father of two children, aged 16 and 9. His business is fishing. He is entrepreneurial, independent, reliable, patient, responsible and hardworking. He does his job in the community of  ‘Cachilaya’, located on the shores of Lake Titicaca in the ecological region of the Boliviano highlands. The climate of this region is cold and the sun rays are very strong.  

Felix is dark skinned, medium height, with a robust complexion and short, black hair. His mother tongue is Aymara and he knows Spanish. He does his work on Lake Titicaca. This activity complements the family farming and livestock life that they are used to and contributes to the family income and brings employment and food for the the family.   

His dream is to improve his income. He wants to buy fishing nets and repair his boat for more safety. This is why Felix is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and to repair his boat.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and to repair his boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Rostiko

texts.en:
Rostiko is a 49-year-old married man with eight children living in Masindi, Uganda. Rostiko sells produce cereals like rice, posho, beans and groundnuts. When he realized that produce only cannot fetch enough income, he built rentals as a supplement.  
 
His dream is to educate his children. Fluctuation of prices and inadequate capital hinder his business.

He needs a loan to buy cereals like rice, posho, beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy cereals like rice, maize, beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stepehen wants a loan to buy mattresses for his guest house. 

He lives in the town of Masindi-Uganda. He has a supermarket, and does farming to generate more income.

He dreams of establishing more businesses to diversify income. Inadequate capital affects his business.

loans.use: to buy matresses for his guest house.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married Ugandan woman with five children, living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a drug store to meet her family's needs. 

Her dream is to educate her children, however, she is faced with a challenge of inadequate capital.

She needs a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 60 years old  and from the community of Carles in Iloilo. She is married with three grown children. Nenita's husband is a carpenter, while Nenita is engaged in her Sari-sari (variety) store business. Nenita has been in this business for 37 years now. She sells basic household needs such as canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, coffee and seasoning. She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, chips, candies, canned goods, coffee, cooking oil, vegetables, shampoo and bath soap. 

She hope that with the additional capital, she can offer variety to her customers, and buy items in bulk that will last for a long time.

In the future, she plan to make her business more successful.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, chips, candies, canned goods, coffee, cooking oil, vegetables, shampoo and bath soap

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 57 years. She is married to Jackson, and together they have been blessed with 10 children, eight who are over 18 years of age; the other two are 13 and 11.

She is a farmer, a business she has done for the last seven years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 5,000. 

Joyce has requested her first loan from VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 20,000, which she will use to purchase manure, maize, beans and wheat seedlings for planting.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable family business.

loans.use: to purchase manure and seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Eylin

texts.es: A Eylin, de 27 años de edad,  una tía le enseño a trabajar la belleza, entendiendo que a ella le gustaba mucho y así fue como empezó su oficio. Posteriormente estudió en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje, donde perfeccionó su técnica, llegando a graduarse de peluquera, lo cual ha ejercido hasta la fecha, durante 8 horas diarias o más, ofreciendo servicios de mejoramiento de imagen personal y profesional,  como tratamientos capilares, peinados, tintes, manicure y pedicure. Hoy 7 años después, ha logrado sostener su negocio y quiere hacerlo crecer, hasta llegar a convertirse en una gran peluquera, posicionada en  la ciudad. Sus metas familiares consisten en  educar a su pequeño hijo, de 1 año de edad integralmente, aunque su mayor desafío sea la falta de capital de trabajo, para comprar los equipos que requiere y mejorar las condiciones de su peluquería. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará lava cabezas, mesas de corte, mesas de manicure, sillas e insumos de belleza. Con esta inversión tendrá la infraestructura física requerida, para tener su peluquería bien estructurada y ganar mucho más, especialmente en este momento, en el que la favorece el mes de Diciembre, en el cual por las fiestas, incrementa sus ventas y esto hace que su credikiva sea una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Eylin is 27 years old; her aunt taught her to work in the beauty field, understanding that she liked it a lot, and in this way she began her career.  Later, she studied in the National Learning Service, where the perfected her technique, later graduating as a hair stylist, which she has been since that time.  For 8 hours or more each day, she is offering services to improve the personal or professional look, such as capillary treatments, hair styles, dyes, manicures, and pedicures. Now, 7 years later, she has managed to sustain her business and wants to make it grow, even to make it into a great beauty salon, well positioned int he city.  

This is the reason she is turning to a Kiva loan, the first loan that she is getting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase a shampoo chair, cutting tables, manicure tables, chairs and beauty supplies. With this investment, she will have the required physical infrastructure to have a well-structured beauty salon and earn a lot more, especially right now, coming up to the month of December, which for all the parties increases her sales and this will make her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase a shampoo chair, cutting tables, manicure tables, chairs and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Meet Christine, an enterprising woman in Kapsabet who is deeply concerned about the financial future of her two daughters. She runs a two-acre farm by keeping dairy cattle and poultry, and growing tea and vegetables. She has been doing this for four years, but her income is still not sufficient to meet her family's basic needs. This forced her to diversify her interest into personal businesses that fall in and out of season. 

She realised that she can make more money by placing more focus on dairy farming. How can she produce more milk for sale without having to purchase more cows that will only strain the available resources? Well, one way is by improving the nutrition and health of her animals. 

Christine is applying for a loan to purchase a chaff cutter. This machine will reduce hay strands into small, evenly-cut chaff that are easily ingestible and digestible. Chaffed hay can also be easily mixed by other feeds to ensure the cow gets a desirable ratio because no chance is left for the animal to select. 

Additional income from this investment will enable Christine to comfortably meet her farm input costs that are quickly becoming prohibitive. Her family will also be positively impacted. When asked about the impact of the loan on her family, she replied, "The chaffed hay will help increase the amount of feed my cows take. This will boost their productivity. My family will get enough milk for consumption and surplus will be sold."

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fishing weights, nylon and ropes

loans.name: Stefany Andrea

texts.es:
Stefany es una joven emprendedora, soltera de 22 años de edad, vive en Huaraz junto a su familia. Por iniciativa propia se dedica a la venta de verduras, trabaja por más de 10 horas al día y cree que le está yendo bien por su esfuerzo constante y ardua labor que realiza día a día. Aun no estudia una profesión, pero su sueño es poder empezar a estudiar por ello está ahorrando su dinero, más adelante quiere convertirse en una exitosa empresaria.
Stefany piensa utilizar el préstamo para poder comprar una cocina y así reemplazar la que tienen en su casa que ya está en malas condiciones y tienen miedo que haya una fuga de gas. Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad y quiere que ellos sepan que esto mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Stefany is an enterprising young woman, single and 22 years old. She lives in Huaraz with her family. By her own initiative, she decided to sell vegetables. She works more than 10 hours each day and believes that it is going well due to her constant efforts and the arduous work that she does day to day.  She has still not studied a career, but her dream is to start to study one, for which she is saving her money. Later, she wants to become a successful businesswoman. 

Stefany plans to use the loan to be able to purchase a range oven and in this way replace the one she has in her house since it is in bad condition and they are scared that there will be a gas leak. She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity and wants them to know that this will improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase a range oven for her house.

loans.name: Aires

texts.en:
Aires has a live-in partner with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aires is 22 years old, and has two children who are currently in school.

Aires has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Aires would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 22 years old and has a live-in partner with one child.  

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Aiza requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aiza has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cherely

texts.en:
Cherely is 28 years old and has a live-in partner with three children. With one child currently in school, Cherely works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, cooking oil, toothpaste, sugar, etc. to sell.

Cherely has been in this business for one year, and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, cooking oil, toothpaste, sugar, etc. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, cooking oil, toothpaste, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Awurade Ne Me Hwefo Group

texts.en:
Awurade Ne Me Hwefo (The Lord is my Shepherd) is a group of five hardworking members, all of whom live in the same district and have different income-generating activities in different places. They are into the sale of foodstuff, second-hand clothing, materials, tea and noodles. The group representative is called Georgina, and she has been part of this group for two years now. She is a 39-year-old married mother. 

The group is on its third loan cycle, and she is requesting this sum to buy Milo, milk, sugar and noodles, and prepared tea to sell at night to customers. Her husband helps her with the daily goings on in the sale of her products. She has more than 12 years of experience in her business, and starts her day at 7.30 am, finishing at 6 pm. 

In the future she would like to be a distributor of these products, be financially autonomous, and spread to other markets. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy Milo, milk, sugar and noodles, and prepared tea

loans.name: Watan

texts.en:
Watan is a 25-year-old university student, majoring in Designing and Applied Arts, and he is in his last year. He is seeking to finish his studies to find a job in his study field, and he is one step closer to that. 

Because Watan doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees from the financial crisis he is facing, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre trabajador, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja como recepcionista en un hospedaje de su ciudad natal, Ica. Es muy emprendedor, en sus tiempos libres también labora como ayudante de electricista y con los ingresos que percibe apoya a su familia en los gastos del hogar.
Julio está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprarse una laptop, con esto estará actualizado y tendrá la posibilidad de estudiar algún curso virtual, también lo utilizará para mejorar su trabajo. Con esto él seguirá esforzándose para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Julio is a hard working man with a desire to get ahead. He works as a receptionist in a hostel in his native city, Ica. He is very entrepreneurial. In his spare time, he also works as an electrician's assistant and, with the income that he receives, he supports his family with their bills.

Julio is thankful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support they have provided, he will be able to buy a laptop. With this he will be up-to-date and will have the possibility of taking an online course. Also, he will use it to improve his work. With this, he will keep working hard in order to be able to improve his quality of life and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his work and to study online courses.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
Marcos es un padre de familia amoroso, una persona que lucha día a día para sacar adelante a su familia, trabaja como operario de construcción en su ciudad natal, Ica. Su familia está conformada por su querida esposa y sus dos maravillosos hijos, ellos siempre han estado unidos en las buenas y en las malas y han sabido superar las dificultades juntos. Su mayor anhelo es ver conteridos a sus hijos en grandes profesionales ya que quiere que ellos tengan un futuro mejor.
Debido a las fuertes ganas que tiene de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Marcos piensa utilizar el crédito para comprar un electrodoméstico y un juego de mueble para su casa, él está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que el se sentirá más tranquilo porque le brindará comodidad a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Marcos is the father of a loving family, a person who struggles day by day to get his family ahead. He works as a construction operator in his hometown, Ica. His family is made up of his beloved wife and their two marvelous children, they have always been close in the good and the bad and have known how to overcome the difficulties together. His greatest desire is to see his children content as important professionals, since he wants them to have a better future. 

Due to the strong desires that he has to improve his family's quality of life, Marcos plans to use the loan to buy an appliance and a set of furniture for his house. His is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity and wants them to know that he will feel more peaceful because he will offer comfort to his loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and appliances to furnish his house.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal QORICHASKAS, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Maruja   tiene 44 años de edad y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar y leche.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The member belongs to the Qorichaskas community bank. The bank is located in the province of Cusco. The member, Maruja, is 44 years old and she is in in a relationship. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery business. She sells basic necessity products like rice, sugar, milk, candies, among other items. She has spent a lot of time dedicating herself to her business, which is going well thanks to the hard work she puts forth every day. She wishes to be able to keep working and keep supporting her family. She is requesting the loan to buy sugar and milk. She is thankful for the loan granted and promises to make her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy sugar and milk.

loans.name: Yeimis

texts.es: Yemis de 32 años de edad se dedica a la decoración, especialmente  en porcelanicron y en foamy. Su negocio nació cuando aprendió las técnicas para elaborar manualidades  en un colegio cercano a  su vivienda. De allí en adelante se ha dedicado a todo lo que tiene que ver con la decoración, especialmente para baby shower, bautizo, fiestas de cumpleaños etc. Sus ventas las realiza de lunes a domingos, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche , vendiendo de contado en el sector y a referidos por personas y propietarios de negocios que ya la conocen. En la actualidad su meta es ampliar su clientela y para ello requiere incrementar su productividad, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas, una vitrina con el fin de producir más e incrementar sus ventas, lo cual impacta positivamente su negocio, acompañado de su experiencia de 7 años, lo que es su mayor fortaleza y con ello planea cumplir su meta final de ahorrar y tener su propia casa, para incrementar el nivel de vida de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos en las edades de 7 a 14 años.
texts.en: Yemis, 32 years old, makes decorations, especially with cold porcelain and art foam sheets. Her business was born when she learned the techniques to make handicrafts in a school near her home. From there, she has worked in everything that has to do with decoration, especially for baby showers, baptisms, birthday parties, etc.  She makes her sales from Monday to Sunday, from 8 in the morning until 7 at night, selling in cash in the area and to people referred to her and owners of businesses who know her. Currently, her goal is to expand her customer base and for that she needs to increase her productivity and for this reason, she turns to a Kiva loan, her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase raw materials and a display case to produce more and increase her sales, which will positively impact her business, along with her 7 years of experience, which is her greatest strength.  With this, she plans to achieve her end goal of saving and having her own house, to improve the living level of her family, made up of her husband and their 5 children, ages 7 to 14.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and a display case.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal QORICHASKAS, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Justina tiene 56 años de edad es viuda y tiene 04 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de ropa al por mayor, la socia vende su mercadería  a todos sus cliente que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas y otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Qorichaskas community bank. The bank is located in the province of Cusco. The member, Justina, is 56 years old. She is a widow and has four children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling clothing at wholesale. She sells her merchandise to all customers who ask. She has been dedicated to this business for some time and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts forth every day. She wishes to be able to keep working so she can continue to support her family. 

She is requesting the loan in order to buy coats and other items. She feels thankful for the loan granted and promises to make her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy coats and other items.

loans.name: Deris

texts.es: Deri de 39 años de edad, es una mujer separada, madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 8 a 19 años. Ella aprendió a ser comerciante, cuando vivió con su pareja anterior, pues lo acompañaba a realizar su tarea comercial diariamente. Con esta experiencia salió adelante, y cuando quedó sola con sus hijos, empezó a trabajar en lo que habia aprendido, hoy sus dos hijos mayores la ayudan, con el fin de generar ingresos para el bienestar de todos ellos. Cuadros, trapeadores, escobas, electrodomésticos menores, toallas y cortinas cepillos, almohadas etc., son los articulos que venden y van de barrio en barrio, para lograr una mayor efectividad haciendo un buen barrido por sector. Su horario de trabajo inicia desde las 7 de la mañana y no cesa hasta las 4 de la tarde. Su meta es ampliar su rango de acción y finalmente tener un local propio, tipo deposito para mantener en perfecto estado sus mercancias. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual compará electrodomésticos menores, toallas, cortinas  etc. para incrementar sus ventas, y dar cumplimiento a los pedidos, con los que se ha comprometido con su clientela. Su mayor desafio es el rel trabajo duro  de su tarea, y las dificultades que tiene para conseguir ahorrar y para alcanzar el bienestar familiar con e que ella sueña.
texts.en: Deri, 39 years old, is separated, and mother of 3 children, ages 8 to 19.  She learned how to be a businesswoman when she lived with her former partner, since she went with him to do his work every day.  With this experience, she got ahead, and when she was left alone with her children, she began to work with what she had leaned. Today her two older children help her, with the end of generating income for all of their well-being. Paintings, mops, brooms, small appliances, towels and curtains, brushes, pillows, etc. are what they sell and they go from neighborhood to neighborhood to be more effective, doing a good sweep by sector. Her work schedule is from 7 in the morning and she doesn't stop until 4 in the afternoon. Her goal is to expand her range of action and, finally, to have her own retail location, a storefront, to keep her merchandise in perfect condition. Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she is taking from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase small appliances, towels, curtains, etc. to increase her sales and fill the orders she has pending with her customers. Her greatest challenge is her job's hard work and the difficulties that she has to be able to save and to achieve the family well-being she dreams of.

loans.use: to purchase small appliances, towels, curtains, etc.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario, tiene la edad  de 58 años, esta viudo, vive solo. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijol de buena calidad que se adapte bien a las condiciones de suelo, topografía y clima que cuenta la zona además de algunos fertilizantes adecuados para aplicarle  después de la germinación y así que tenga un desarrollo adecuado en las primeras semanas, también realizar algunos trabajos de labores culturales como lo son la conservación de suelos por medio de realización de canales a nivel para que el agua de lluvia no pueda realizar lavados del suelo principalmente en las partes con mas pendientes, con estas nuevas prácticas de trabajo espera cumplir con el objetivo de tener una plantación con mejor sanidad y un suelo con mas fertilidad y por ende una mejor cosecha. También con esta compra de productos adecuados tendrá una calidad mejor de producto para el consumidor. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en los bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Mario is 58 years old, a widower, and lives alone. With his loan, he plans to purchase good quality bean seeds that will adapt well to the soil conditions, topography, and climate of his zone, in addition some appropriate fertilizer to use on them, after germination and in this way they will develop well in the first weeks.  He will also complete some cultural work such as soil conservation by making some channels at level so that the rain water doesn't wash out the soil, primarily in the areas with steeper slopes. With these new work practices, he hopes to meet his objective of having a healthier plantation and more fertile soil, with the end of a better harvest. He also will purchase appropriate products and will have a better quality product for the consumer.  This is his first loan that he has gotten from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any previous loans with the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better conditions and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Castinaldo

texts.es:
Castinaldo tiene 38 años de edad, tiene un hogar estable al lado su cónyuge y dos menores hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad, él de 10 años está en colegio primario y la segunda en Pronoi del caserío Palma Central, que está ubicado en el distrito Santo Tomás. Castinaldo tienen casa propia de material rustico de un piso y cuenta con servicios de agua. Él y su cónyuge son naturales del caserío Palma Central; vive en armonía familiar y en comunión con los miembros de su caserío. Dicho caserío está ubicado en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Castinaldo es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 has. Variedad Catimor, plantación variada está en primer y segundo año de producción, para campaña 2015 estará en segundo y tercer año de producción; tiene terreno agrícola propio 3,5 has. La cual es una parcela de café. Esta actividad la realiza hace 04 años aproximadamente en caserío Palma Central en el distrito Santo Tomás, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café, producto lo vende en su distrito y alrededores. Adicionalmente cliente se dedica a al cultivo de caña, contando con 0,5 has. Para elaboración de aguardiente y al cultivo de productos de Pan Llevar todo esto lo realiza en terreno propio en caserío Palma Central distrito Santo Tomás.

El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de 2 has. De café en producción, con ello asegurará mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su utilidad y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Castinaldo is 38 years old. He has a stable home at the side of his spouse and their two minor children, ages 10 and 4. The 10-year-old is in primary school and the second in the preschool of the Palma Central village, which is located in Santo Tomás district. Castinaldo has his own one-floor house made of rustic materials and has water and sewer services. He and his spouse are natives of Palma Central village, they live in a harmonious family and get along well with the other members of their village. This village is located in Santo Tomás district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.  

The work Castinaldo does is growing coffee, currently having 2 hectares of Catimor variety. His plantation is varied and is in its first and second year of production. During the 2015 season, it will be in the second and third year of production. He has his own agricultural land of 3.5 hectares, which is a coffee plantation. He has done this work for approximately 4 years in Palma Central village in Santo Tomás district. He has experience in the field of coffee growing, a product that he sells in his district and nearby areas. Additionally, he works growing sugar cane, having 0.5 hectares for making aguardiente, and to grow grains. All this he does on his own land in Palma Central village, Santo Tomás district.

The purpose of the loan will be to maintain the 2 hectares of coffee in production, with it he will assure a larger and better production for the 2015 season and with the end of having increased income and, in turn, be able to improve his utility, and also his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain 2 hectares of coffee in production, and with this assure a larger and better harvest for the 2015 season.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Karina se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales(patos, cuyes, conejos, entre otros), con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para compra de más animales(pavos, gallinas, entre otros), dado que desea aumentar y diversificar su stock de animales, para poder atender a todos los gustos y preferencias de su público consumidor; dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; lo que en un corto plazo le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Karina is 31 years old, partnered, has 2 children, and lives with her family in a rural zone in Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. Her community primarily works in agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade. 

Karina works growing and selling animals (ducks, guinea pigs, rabbits, among others), with more than 10 years of experience in the business, which is located in the rear part of her home. She asks for a loan to purchase more animals (turkeys, chickens, among others), given that she wants to expand and diversify her animal stock, to be able to meet all the tastes and preferences of her consumer public.  This investment will help her to have a larger variety and productivity of animals, with a great influence on her business, which in the short term in generate more income, more profit, and in the end will improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase more animals (turkeys, chickens, among others), given that she wants to expand and diversify her animal stock.

loans.name: Cesar Yovani

texts.es:
Cesar Yovani tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, sin carga familiar. Vive en casa de sus padres junto a ellos. Su familia es muy unida; él cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería; dicha comunidad está ubica en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Cesar Yovani se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte urbano en su mototaxi en su distrito y alrededores de del mismo, desde hace 03 años. Además, eventualmente percibe ingresos por servicios de construcción. El destino del préstamo es para realizar mantenimiento de mototaxi(arreglos en el motor y cambio de carpa) lo que le permitirá asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo. Así, ofrecerá una mejor atención a sus clientes, otorgándoles un mejor servicio, lo que en un corto plazo le permitirá captar a un número mayor de clientes y así poder aumentar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar Yovani is 22 years old and single, without family responsibility. He lives in his parents' home with them. His family is very close, and he has many good personal and work references on the part of his neighbors. He lives in a community that works in trade, agriculture and animal husbandry. This community is in Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

Cesar Yovani has worked offering urban transportation service in his motorcycle taxi in his district and neighboring areas for the past 3 years. In addition, he occasionally gets income by working in construction. The purpose of this loan is to do maintenance on his motorcycle taxi (repairs to the motor and replacing the awning) which will allow him to assure the correct functioning of his work tool. In this way, he will offer better customer service, providing them with better service, which in the sort term will allow him to get more customers and, in turn, be able to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his motorcycle taxi (repairs to the motor and replace the awning).

loans.name: Matilde Rosa

texts.es:
Matilde Rosa tiene 42 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge en el distrito de La Matanza. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente debido a que no existe delincuencia, en lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que se desarrolla, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería y crianza de animales. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Matilde Rosa es la venta de chicha de jora, y crianza de animales menores(aves especialmente, tales como pavo, palomas, entre otros). La actividad la realiza desde hace más de 4 años, en el distrito. El destino del crédito será para realizar la compra de materia prima y arreglos de su local, donde ofrece la venta de sus chicha de jora. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el producto se vende de manera semanal en la zona. Ella Piensa trabajar otorgando buen servicio en base a un buen producto y agregándole el que también ofrecerá un buen ambiente donde disfrutar dicho producto. Generándole de esta forma en un corto plazo, mayores ventas, mejores ganancias y por ende le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Matilde Rosa is 42 years old, married, has 3 children, and lives in her own house with her spouse in La Matanza district. Life in the district is peaceful because there isn't any crime. In respect to the business or other work that is done there, the population works in agriculture, animal husbandry and raising animal. This district is located in Morropón province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

The work Matilde Rosa does is selling chicha de jora (corn beer) and raising small animals (specifically birds such as turkey and doves, among others). She has done this work for more than 4 years in the district. The use of this loan is to purchase raw material and make some repairs to her retail location where she sells her chicha de jora. The market has good perspectives since she sells the product weekly in the zone. She plans to work offering a good service based on a good product and adding to it also offering a good environment to enjoy the product. In this way, in the short term it will generate more sales and more income with the end that it will permit her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and make repairs to her retail location, where she sells chicha de jora (corn beer).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron and sheet meal to build a bedroom for her home.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 35 years old and has six children who are currently in school. She has a live-in partner with eight children. For the past nine years, Ethel has been raising pigs in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ethel is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eggs, soy sauce, canned goods, noodles, chips and seasoning

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: José de 56 años de edad habita en vivienda propia desde hace 20 años junto a su compañera de vida, sus 2 hijos y un nieto. Él es un hombre que desde muy temprano sale a ganarse la vida fabricando y vendiendo diversidad de artículos desde hace 10 años. José desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda por que cuando llueve sus familiares y sus pocas pertenencias se mojan por lo deteriorado de las laminas y corre el riesgo que se desplome porque la madera ya perdió fuerza, es por ello que él desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: madera, lamina, clavos y mano de obra para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 56 years old, and has lived in his own home for 20 years together with wife, two children, and a grandson.  He is a man who goes out very early to  earn a living by manufacturing and selling a variety of items, which he has done for ten years. 

José wants to change the roof of his house because when it rains his family and his few belongings get wet since the plastic sheeting has deteriorated, and there is a risk that it will collapse because the wood has lost its strength.  That is why he wants to change the roof on his home.  

He has asked for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in wood, plastic sheeting, nails, and the labor to change the roof on his house.

loans.use: to invest in wood, plastic sheeting, nails, and the labor to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in beams, galvanized sheet metal and fasteners to replace the roof on her home.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now, and she works hard to support her family. 

Evelyn is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry and farm inputs

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 35-year-old owner of an eatery, locally known as "carenderia," in the town of Carles, Iloilo. She has two children ages 13 and 16. For the last 16 years, Arlene’s business has provided for them. She usually cooks adobo (a dish which consists of chunks of meat that are marinated in vinegar, soy sauce, garlic and peppercorn and cooked until tender), sautéed vegetables, fried fish, and noodles. 

Arlene is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, soy sauce, vinegar, and spices. She will use the income from her loan to provide for the schooling of her children. Arlene hopes to continue expanding her business and improving her menu to attract more customers and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, soy sauce, vinegar and spices

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Don Alfredo, tiene 67 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene 4 hijos, y reside en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, tiene 14 años de cultivar chile verde dulce, esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos para la manutención de sus hijos. Su producción la vende en la misma zona donde llegan sus clientes a comprarle. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 22,000 Lempiras, ya es el tercer ciclo en la institución. Piensa invertir en compra de fertilizantes, semillas y en pago de limpieza para siembra de chile verde dulce y a su vez brindarle buena asistencia al cultivo. Su idea es tener un cultivo bien asistido, crecer como productor de chile y obtener mas ingresos para la familia.
texts.en: Don Alfredo is 67-years old.  He is single, has four children and lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.  He makes his living in agriculture.  For fourteen years he has grown green peppers, which is his source of income for supporting his children.  He sells his produce in the area where the customers come to make their purchases.  Don Alfredo is requesting a loan of 22,000 Lempiras (USD $1050).  It is his third lending cycle with the institution.  He plans to invest in fertilizers and seeds, to pay for having his fields prepared to plant green peppers and to take good care of his crop.  Don Alfredo's plan is to have a well-cared for crop, to grow as a pepper producer and to have more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds, to pay for having his fields prepared to plant green peppers and to take good care of his crop.

loans.name: Shaiyr

texts.ru: Шайыр 50 лет, не замужем, мать 3 детей. Образование медицинское средне-специальное. В летнее время года Шайыр сдает туристам коттеджи и бизнесменам помещениЯ под офисы, у Шайыр уже наработаны постоянные клиенты. Также с 1996 года занимается перепродажей фруктов: яблок и груш. Она покупает фрукты у местных жителей, затем хранит их в холодильниках для экспорта в ноябре и декабре месяце оптовым покупателям в России и Казахстане.  Ежемесячный совокупный доход Шайыр на сегодняшний день доходит до 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шайыр обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку яблок и груш для дальнейшей их перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Шайыр планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на свадьбу ее сына и образование младшей дочери.
texts.en:
Shaiyr is 50 and unmarried with three children. She has a specialist high school education in medicine. In the summer, she rents cottages to tourists and apartments with offices to businessmen, and she has already earned regular customers. She has also been working selling apples and pears since 1996. She buys the fruit from local residents and then stores it in refrigerators for export in November and December to wholesale buyers in Russia and Kazakhstan. Her total monthly income is close to 25,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Shaiyr has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase apples and pears for further resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business, and to save toward her son's wedding and her youngest daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase apples and pears for resale

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Delfina is 38 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Delfina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Delfina has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 35 years old and has four children. Divina is married and her four children are in school.

Divina is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Divina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Divina has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 37 years old and has seven children who are currently in school.

Jocelyn has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and fishing gear for her business

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 32 years old and has six children. Elvie is married and five of her children are currently in school.

Elvie is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins, feed and other supplies for her pigs.

Elvie has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feed and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.   She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Marites has been in this business for 20 years now.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Justa

texts.en:
Justa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Justa is 49 years old and has three children who are in school.

Justa has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional plastic bottles, etc.  She has been in this business for six years.  In the future, Justa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastic bottles, etc.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 31 years old and married.  She has six children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Ann has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from bamboo stripes weaving.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Angelica Carolina

texts.es: Angelica de 25 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada especialmente ropa, calzado y accesorios femeninos. Su idea empresarial inició hace 4 años, cuando su tía se afilió a diversa organizaciones, que venden mediante catálogos, y logró entusiasmarla para que ella  hiciera lo mismo. Así empezó su trabajo independiente y hoy vende no solo a crédito,  sino también de contado, todos los días desde las 5 de la tarde a las 8 y 30 de la noche. Sus compras las realiza de contado y espera que haya productos, con descuentos especiales para llevarlo a su clientela y ofrecerle siempre lo mejor, a un precio de oportunidad. Su meta es apoyar la profesionalización de su hermana y escalar más en su negocio, para apoyar el fortalecimiento de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y su hijo de 3 años de edad. En la actualidad esta aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado y accesorios femeninos. Con esta inversión tendrá mucha más liquidez para invertir y disminuirá sus costos de venta, lo que hacen de este crédito una inversión exitosa,  que impactará positivamente el desempeño de este negocio.
texts.en:
Angelica is 25 years old and makes a living selling various merchandise, particularly women's clothing, footwear, and accessories.  Her business idea began four years ago, when her aunt affiliated with various organizations that sell through catalogs and managed to fill her with enthusiasm to do the same thing.  Thus began her independent work, and today she not only sells via credit but also with cash.  She sells every day from 5:00 in the evening to 8:30 at night.  She makes her purchases with cash and hopes that there will be products with special discounts so that she can take them back to her customers and always offer them the best at a good price.  

Her goal is to support the professionalization of her sister and to move up in her business in order to support the strengthening of her family, which is made up of her spouse and three-year-old son.  Right now she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first funding that she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy women's clothing, footwear, and accessories.  With this investment, she will have more liquidity to invest in and reduce her sales costs, which would make this loan a successful investment and would positively impact the performance of this business.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing, footwear, and accessories.

loans.name: Ma. Wilma

texts.en:
Ma. Wilma is a sari-sari store owner from the community of Carles in Iloilo. She is also engaged in fishing. She is married with five grown children.  These businesses allowed her to buy for their needs when they were younger. She is asking for a loan to continue investing in her business.  She will use her loan to buy fishing nets, rope, nylon, fishing weights, canned goods, seasoning, toiletries and sugar.

Ma. Wilma also dreamed of saving for old age. In the future, she hopes to make her business bigger and better for her customers and for increased business profits.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, rope, nylon, fishing weights, canned goods, seasoning, toiletries and sugar

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Fishing has been a good business for most people in Carles, Iloilo. This includes Bella, who is a resident of this place. 

Bella is 53 years old and married with five grown children. For 26 years now, she has been engaged in fishing to provide for her children. She is asking for a loan to continue improving her livelihood. It will be used to buy fishing nets, fishing weights, nylon and rope. 

Bella finds joy in doing fishing and helping her husband, who is also a fisherman.

In the future, she hopes to have enough savings, be more successful in business and live a life of abundance.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fishing weights, nylon and rope

loans.name: Mohamed M

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Mohamed.  He is married, and has two children, aged 15 and 7yrs. In 2012, Mohamed established his tea shop business. He began this business to complement his bakery because he is a baker. He decided to sell bread and tea to the community, so that he could increase his source of income to provide a livelihood for his family. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy eggs, ovaltine, coffee, sugar and soft drinks. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  In the future, Mohamed plans to establish a restaurant in his community, as his customers are always requesting him to do so.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy eggs, ovaltine, coffee, sugar and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 47 years old and married with eight children. With three children currently in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Rowena has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, sugar, coffee, milk, juice, candies, etc. 

In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Loyola

texts.en:
Loyola is 51 years old and widowed, with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Loyola runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like rice, shampoo, cigarettes, etc.

Loyola has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future, Loyola would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like rice, shampoo, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a student at the Nurses and Midwifery Training College, studying General Nursing, and hopes to become a registered nurse in the near future. The loan is to help pay her fees, without which she would have to fall on friends for support. 

The pursuance of the program would help her serve her country, and also render support to the community and family, as well as be self-reliant.

Her friends and family inspire her to achieve her dreams, because they recognize the potential in her and encourage her to go higher on the educational ladder and not to relent in her quest to becoming a medical doctor in the future.

She aspires to be a medical doctor in five to 10 years; this, she said, would bring out her maximum prowess in her chosen career.

Without the help of this loan, it would have been tough; however, they would have tried their luck with other financial institutions.

“My country is currently economically stable and would like to recommend investors to come in and invest to create more jobs for the youth.”

loans.use: To pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in switches, electrical wiring, cable, etc. in order to redo home electrical wiring.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Imelda is 48 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Imelda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business and earns additional income from a general store.  Imelda has been in this business for five years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en:
