Ediltrudes works hard to support her family. Ediltrudes is married and has a shell craft business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Ediltrudes has been in this business for 10 years now.  In the future, Ediltrudes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas, the mother of four children, has been a farmer for many years now. She lives together with her family in Nandi Hills, Kenya. She keeps dairy cows and poultry at her farm, and her primary source of income is milk and eggs. She makes extra money on the side holding a wage-paying job and venturing into small personal businesses. 

Dorcas is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She enjoys raising chickens. She has been to trainings that have empowered her to take calculated business risks. With your loan, Dorcas will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra. 

Dorcas is very concerned about her children’s education; profits that will be acquired from the poultry will go to her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas, 29, is a smallholder farmer based in Koyo village up in the North Rift region of Kenya. She is a hardworking lady who is striving to provide the best for her four children. Her main income sources are milk, eggs and tea.  For the 13 years that she has been involved in farming, she admits that activity that warms her heart most is the feeding of chicks. She faces various market-related challenges but that alone is not going to stop her from doing poultry farming.

Dorcas is seeking a loan to purchase poultry and farm implements. The new acquisition of poultry will give her more eggs for selling and for hatching. Male chicks and hens that grow old and become less productive will be sold for meat. The old worn out tools in her farm will be replaced with modern, well-designed tools that are more effective and efficient. 

She is going to use the returns from this investment to manage other business related expenses. By plowing profits back into the business, she will help it get off the ground. However, the biggest benefit of this loan, according to Dorcas, is that it will put food on the table for her children. Food security is something that many families take for granted but, being where Dorcas has been, food on the table is something she has to be so grateful to God about.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements and poultry

loans.name: Agape Group

texts.en: This group has been in existence for three loan cycles with the micro finance branch in Chorkor. The group is comprised of women who all live in the same neighborhood. They get along well with one another and are united by good group spirit. They are essentially involved in small retail business. They are into foodstuff, materials, groundnuts and toiletries. Agartha is the group's featured borrower. She is 38 years old, single, has three dependent children. She is actively involved in the sale of food (cassava, yams, plantain, tomatoes, etc.), which she buys in bulk quantity from the wholesale market. With her new loan, Agartha will buy cassava, yams, plantain, tomatoes, etc. and sell them to customers. Agartha will use her profits to take care of her three dependent children's educational needs as well as her own needs. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff (cassava, yams, plantain, tomatoes, etc.) and sell to customers

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers for her vegetable vending business.

Josefina has been in this business for 7 years. Josefina earns additional income from a general store.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 55 years old and married with ten children. Two of her children are in school. Lydia works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a dried fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of dried fish to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 38 years old and has one child. Alicia is married and her child is in school.

Alicia is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

Alicia has been raising cattle for 5 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 32 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Alma has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs.

Alma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 46 years old and has two children. Antonia is married and has one child who is still in school.

Antonia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Antonia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Antonia has been raising livestock for 12 years now and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Antonia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is 57 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Hermenia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Hermenia has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jeanie Rose

texts.en:
Jeanie Rose is 43 years old and married with two children.

Jeanie Rose works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, canned goods, snack foods, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Jeanie Rose has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns income from raising pigs.

Jeanie Rose aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, canned goods, snack foods, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 43 years old and married. She has five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonora has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Leonora is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lovely Rose

texts.en:
Lovely Rose is 35 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

Lovely Rose is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Lovely Rose has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Lovely Rose requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feeds and vitamins for her business.

In the future, Lovely Rose would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feeds and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 37-year-old married woman from Rustavi city. She lives with her husband, who works at the glass factory and generates 400 GEL monthly. As Tea has secondary education and couldn't start any stable job, she started working as a nurse. She takes care of 2 children and generates a small income. In order to increase her productivity and monthly income, Tea decided to be involved in a trading business also. She requested a loan for purchasing stock of clothing and stationary things at wholesale prices. She plans to sell products in her community at increased prices.
 
Her loan application was approved within the start up program that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. Her income will significantly increase because of the start up program and Tea will be able to tackle financial difficulties. 

She awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase stock of clothing and stationary things and start trading.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat, 27, is a father of 1 who makes a living doing mixed farming in Kipsebwo village located in North Rift Kenya. He keeps dairy animals and poultry for commercial milk and eggs respectively. Besides mixed-farming, Josphat is also very concerned about the health of the environment. He spends most of his time working on his tree seedling yard. He stated that the tree nursery is very demanding. He spends a lot of time working in the nursery because he lacks proper equipment.
 
Josphat is seeking a KES 35,000 loan to purchase farm implements. These tools will make the work on his farm move much faster and easier. Tending to his tree nursery involves a lot of digging, uprooting, planting and packaging. There are various tools in the market that are handy for a man in his line of duty. The equipment does not come cheap, however. 

The increase in income from this investment will go to his family's welfare and his child's education.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two router tables, one fretsaw for cutting curves and inside corners, and other furniture materials.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a businessman in Nairobi. He is married and has two children. He noticed one day that there were very few public sanitation facilities in the market area where he runs his daily business. This made him think of a way he could chip in to provide a solution to this challenge. He then learned about the Fresh Life Franchise as he was looking for a solution to the sanitation issue. He was impressed by the already existing impact on sanitation which is a result of the franchise's existence in other areas. He now seeks a loan to help him purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets to be set up in a highly populated market area. He hopes that the toilets will ease the sanitation challenge and help him generate more revenue to enable him to purchase more facilities and repay his loan. He will also use part of the income from the franchise for personal improvement.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Mercury Group

texts.en:
Philipo, who is in his mid 20s, is single. He has been selling chips with mshikaki, fish, firigisi and eggs for one year now. He works from 9 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Philipo's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to start selling soft drinks. He dreams of becoming a millionaire.

Philipo will share this loan with his loan group "Mercury," which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy  more fabrics to resell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 43 years old and married. She has six children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Mildred has been in pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. 

Mildred is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase piglets, feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Villa

texts.en:
Ma. Villa, 50, is a married woman with seven children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ma. Villa has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

Ma. Villa requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like rope, plastic containers, etc.

In the future, Ma. Villa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like rope, plastic containers, etc.

loans.name: God's Time Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of nine members, with eight females and one male. They live in the same neighborhood and are into the trading of foodstuffs, eggs, ornamentals, wigs, groceries, maize, banku (cook corn dough), onions and secondhand clothing. The group needs a total amount of 7,600 GHS to expand their businesses. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

Gladys, who sells products such as rice and oil, is very excited to receive her third loan from ID-Ghana, after having repaid her previous loans and thus taken a step towards expanding her business. With this loan, she is planning to use 1,000 GHS to purchase rice and oil in bulk and sell to customers. Gladys says that her most important challenge and goal is to set up a store where she can sell all of her items instead of going outside and walking in her community and others nearby. She enjoys being at home with her eight-year-old child. Gladys is planning to reinvest her profits in her business and save for her future plans and challenges.

loans.use: To purchase rice and oil in bulk to sell to customers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 32 years old and married. She has two children.

Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns additional income from manicure/pedicure service and electronic mobile load retailing. 

Victoria requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Victoria has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan.

Victoria aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Joji

texts.en:
Joji is 33 years old and has seven children. She is married and four of her children are currently in school.

Joji is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Joji has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Joji would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Patima

texts.en:
Patima, who is 30 years old and married, lives in the capital of Georgia. Her husband is temporarily unemployed nowadays. The family didn't have any source of income until Patima started her own business. She had graduated from Medical University and has always had a desire to work according to her profession. So she has opened little pharmacy and started working as a pharmacist on her own. 

Patima has not much income but is very satisfied with the business. However, now she requires financial support to increase the productivity and make her business more profitable. Patima wants to purchase stock of medicines to have a wide assortment and satisfy all her clients' needs. She already has loyal customers and will continue her lovely job in a more profitable way.
 
The loan will greatly assist Patima and her husband, enabling them to live in better condition and to expand the business as well. Patima relies on the good will of Kiva lenders and will be grateful for the help.

loans.use: To purchase stock of medicine for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 49 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like diapers, sanitary pads, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as diapers, sanitary pads, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, etc. 

Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like diapers, sanitary pads, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline, 40, lives in Koyo village, located near the Great Rift Valley escarpments in Kenya. She practices mixed-farming on a 10-acre piece of land that is owned by her family to support her four children. For 12 years, she has been making a living selling milk, eggs, tea, and other food crops from her farm. She is also actively engaged in other small businesses to make an extra shilling. 

Everline is seeking a loan to purchase poultry and feed. She is in love with poultry farming. She spends most of her time feeding her chickens. She also spends quality time with a cow she named 'Mulgulmet' which means round-headed cow. She hopes that with your lending, she will purchase more poultry. She is well-capable of taking care of dozens more chickens on her farm. She will grow her income and asset base significantly with the new acquisition. 
Profits from the investment will be ploughed back into the business to support the business growth. The loan will elevate the family's livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors and windows for her house.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 61 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Teodora has been in pig fattening for 30 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. 

Teodora is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty works hard to support her family. Betty is married and has a buy-and-sell native products business in the Philippines.

Betty requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional native products like broomsticks, baskets, etc. to sell.

Betty has been in this business for 25 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Betty would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional native products like broomsticks, baskets, etc. to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Regina, a farmer who practices agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge attained through agricultural training and business studies to develop her agriculture business. 

Regina has been practicing farming for the last five years on her small plot, where she does mixed farming. She enjoys farming so much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide the basic needs to them. 

Having the traits of a go-getter, Regina has always dreamt big. She has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to start a cereal-selling shop and make her dream come true. With your loan, Regina will be able to improve her income levels and be able to comfortably take care of her family. Regina’s' projections are that by the end of the first year, she would be able to start another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. 

Through the profits generated from the business, she would be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and family.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, 53, is a smallholder farmer in the Nandi hills area of Kenya. In the past eight years, she has bred more than five dairy cows, developed her farm, and planted and sold a variety of crop. She says the secret to her success is  thinking of farming as a way to make money, not just as a traditional way of life – adopting new technologies and methods, crop diversification, record-keeping and good planning also help. 

Sarah was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming. Sarah always says, “I have always had an affinity for farming; it runs in my blood.” Because of how much she likes farming she has even nicknamed one of her cows “Boxy” which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows.. 

Through her dairy cow, she is able to get between 10-15 liters a day, and this helps her support her family. Sarah also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements and that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. 

Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques; using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. Sarah is visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Sarah believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her child a solid educational background. This loan will be Sarah’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 44 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school, Diosdada works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like dozen of eggs, noddles, soap, sugar, oil, soy sauce, shampoo, etc.

Diosdada has been in this business for five years.

In the future Diosdada would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like dozen of eggs, noddles, soap, sugar, oil, soy sauce, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 43 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell gasoline business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Emma has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running this business for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Emma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Lourdes is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase more fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 34 years old, married, and has six children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marites has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Marites has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice grain business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell from her buy-and-sell rice grain business.

Letecia has been in this business for 8 years. However, she also earns additional income from farming rice. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, along with the help of loans from NWTF. 

Letecia dreams of building and expanding her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grain to sell.

loans.name: Azizjon

texts.ru: Азизчон жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый человек. Он сын фермера. Его родители занимается выращиванием картошки и зерна. Его родители не имеют высшего образования и поэтому они всегда мечтали, чтобы их сын получил высшее образование. Азизчон в этом году успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Он данное время является студентом 1 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции. Азизчон учит банковское дело. Он обратился за займом для того, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор. Его родители не имеют денег, чтобы оплатить за его учебу. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Azizjon is a cheerful and hardworking person. He is the son of a farmer. His parents grow potatoes and grains. Neither of them has a higher education and therefore they have always dreamed of sending their son to university. Azizjon successfully graduated from high school this year and enrolled at the university. He is currently a first year student at the Tajik State University of Commerce and is studying banking. He applied for a loan in order to pay his tuition because his parents do not have the money to pay for his studies. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 51 years old, married, and has 2 children.

She works hard to provide for her family. Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Marilou has already borrowed and successfully repaid 7 loans from NWTF. She has been running her general store for 5 years, but she also earns income from rice retailing and raising chickens and goats.

Marilou aspires to build and expand her business in order to provide a good future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.en:
Maximina is 66 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like noodles, oil, dozens of eggs, sugar, shampoo, groceries, and other items. Maximina has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns income from pig fattening.

Maximina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like noodles, oil, dozens of eggs, sugar, shampoo, groceries, and other items.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business. Roselyn has been in this business for five years. Roselyn earns more income from buying and selling rice and gasoline. Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of  loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Recolita

texts.en:
Recolita is 67 years old, married, and a resident of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer. They have three grown children.  

Starting with capitalization of 4,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari store (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of PMPC. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits of PMPC. She became a member in April 2010 and has taken out three loans. 

Now she is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.  In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart, and will be fully satisfied if she can help generate employment for her neighbor.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 42 years old and married with one child.

Mary Jane runs a veterinary supplies business in the Philippines and has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional veterinary supplies to sell, such as feed. Mary Jane has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Mary Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional veterinary supplies to sell, such as feed

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 46 years old and is married with 5 children, who are all in school. Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell like shampoo, cigarettes, canned goods, etc. She has been in this business for 7 years now.  

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, cigarettes, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Cardina

texts.en:
Cardina thought that she's on the right track for her needed capital when she joined PMPC to start her sari-sari store business. Now she wants to venture into an agriculture business, focusing on farming activities.  PMPC came as a rescue to Cardina for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she has asked for another loan to pay for labor for land and seedbed preparation to continuously provide for her family. 

Cardina perseveres and always believes that she will reach her goals. In the future, she wants to buy a hectare of land to expand her farming activities for possible business opportunities.

loans.use: prepare her farmland

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 48 years old, married and a resident of Marapong, Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte, Philippines.  Her husband is a tricycle driver. They are blessed with 2 children. 

Because it is hard for them to survive if only her husband is working, Rosario decided to engage herself in selling.  She started a sari-sari (mini- grocery) store with a capital of 3,000 PHP.  Her primary customers are their neighbors. Successfully, she was able to manage it well, and is able to finance the daily needs of her family with the help of Paglaum Cooperative, which she became a member last May 2008. 

Rosario was able to avail herself of three loans and repaid them religiously. Now, she applied for another loan of 14,900PHP to finance the additional stocks to purchase for her sari-sari store. She is looking forward to expanding her sari-sari into a mini-mart someday.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas has a hobby of listening to music and he loves to sing as well. He came up with the idea of a videoke bar. Not only is he enjoying it, but he also earns a meager income to support his health needs. He busies himself to sufficiently provide for the family. 

He grabbed the opportunity to become a member of PMPC. He credits the cooperative with helping with his financing needs to buy another "Videoke" machine for added income to help with his grandchildren's school expenses. 

In the future, Nicolas wishes to own more "Videoke" units and put one in every store or resort so that he can also help others to earn income.

loans.use: to buy another "Videoke" machine for added income to help with his granchildren's school expenses

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Milagros is 54 years old, married and lives in Marapong, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. 

Through Pauglam PC, Milagros obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes & prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income from her parents. Someday, she wants to build additional a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is married with four children. She is 48 years old and lives in Marapong, Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte. 

Myrna is a farmer and grows corn and root crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 14 years. She has requested a loan to acquire land for corn and root crops production. 

Myrna has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Myrna hopes to harvest more corn and variety of root crops such as peanut, potato and cassava.

loans.use: buy land to farm

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and children in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is a farmer who plants rice, corn, vegetables, beans and root crops.  

Rosita wants to increase her sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to pay for seedlings and compost to expand her farming activities so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: buy compost and seedlings

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita has always had the enthusiasm for farming.  She has cultivated rice in Baliangao and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work.   

Recently, Mercedita applied a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting.  Mercedita knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. 

In the future, Mercedita hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: prepare her farmland

loans.name: Adelo

texts.en:
Adelo is 52 years old. He is known in the Tudela area for his vegetable gardening, from which he earns an income to support his family. He is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. 

Adelo hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, and has applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and lumber for his house. He hopes to maintain his membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. 

Adelo has found assistance for his family's financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and he is very thankful with all his heart. Someday he hopes to become a supplier of vegetables in nearby towns and be able to provide his family a better life.

loans.use: renovate his home

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is from Silanga, Tangub City.  She is 48 years old, married and has five children. 

Nelia is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired in supporting her family. 

Recently, Nelia availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding more pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in nearby towns.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos earns a living through rice farming, an activity he mastered after he was married. Through his rice farming, he has been able to support his family and provide his children with a good education. 

Carlos hopes to live comfortably with a well-built house. PMPC helped his financing needs by granting him a loan of 30,000 PHP. This loan allows Carlos to purchase construction materials to complete an ample, concrete living space with a good roof for the whole family.

He hopes to keep his PMPC membership in good standing with a good repayment record. 

In the future, Carlos would like to own a truck and become a supplier of rice in the local market.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to complete his house and finish it with a solid roof.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is juggling a business in doing her gardening activities. Not only that she is doing her hobby, she earns an income as well.  At the age of 48 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide her family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. 

Trinidad hopes to have a decent and comfortable living space in a house with good roofing for her family, supported by her loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase construction materials.   She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with good repayment record. She deeply wishes for a good education to her kids and for them to have businesses on their own.

loans.use: renovate her home

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her gardening in flowers. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired in supporting her family. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. 

In the future, Jocelyn wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: buy gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: White Rose Group

texts.en:
Fanil, who is his early 30's, is single.  He has been running a business of selling chips (with meat, eggs, and chicken) and soft drinks for four years now.  He works from 8:00am to 10:30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Thi will be Fanil's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use this loan to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, goat meat, cow meat and soft drinks.  He dreams of making his business grow. 

Fanil will share this loan with his loan group "White Rose," which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, goat meat, cow meat and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Jenevib

texts.en: In 2009, Jenevib learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Tudela, she took out a loan to jump start her farm production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Jenevib feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she took out a new loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Jenevib wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply vegetables in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is from Lazi, Siquijor, Philippines. She is married with five children, who are all school aged. Milagros is earning a profit through her fish-vending business. She has had this business for nine years, helping the family to survive. 

This year, Milagros joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock of fish to sell. Through this, she hopes to increase her income so that she is able to provide for the daily needs of her family, and she is also happy that she can support the education of her children, which is her main priority in her hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda, 56 years old, is married with four children. Her husband works as a manual laborer but earns just enough for the family to live hand to mouth. Luzviminda was striving hard to earn a living without a stable job. The education of her four children and the family's day-to-day consumption are challenging, so she decided to open a store selling basic commodities.  

Luzviminda is thankful that she joined PMPC. With very little capital, she was able to start the sari-sari (general store) business. Its daily sales go the extra mile in meeting the family's needs. The family is also able to save with their extra income. 

Luzviminda has applied to PMPC for additional capital of 30,000 PHP. She says she was attracted to PMPC for its savings and insurance services. She wants to gradually expand her little store and taste a good life someday.

loans.use: to buy stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 46 year old and a resident of Poblacion, Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte, Philippines. He has four kids, one of whom is in college. He owns a sari-sari store (small grocery store) that forms part of their house, and his neighbors are their clients. 

Since he has a college student to support, he has decided to improve their small business to support their children. So he has requested a loan at PMPC in the amount of 6,000 PHP. Aside from the financial assistance, he has also received add-on benefits like insurance, savings, etc. He hopes that with PMPC's help, he will become a successful businessman someday.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his sari-sari store

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a coconut business in Tudela and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up with PMPC to gain access to capital. She wants to increase her coconut inventory to support her family's needs.Jenny hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: To buy coconuts for her business to support her family's needs

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie is a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Menchie is 33 years old and has four children, who are in school.

Menchie has a fishing business in the Philippines and has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing materials.

Menchie has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Mency

texts.en:
Mency is 50 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 11,000 PHP loan NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mency has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mency aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emalyn

texts.en: Emalyn finds pleasure in gardening which is a hobby that earns her income as well. Emalyn is 38 and married. She earns sufficiently to provide for her family. She seized the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for providing her with capital to support her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to buy fertilizer for her plants. Her increased income will help to send her children to school. In the future, Emalyn wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her plants

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana tiene 54 años de edad, es separada, tiene 02 hijos dependientes, vive con sus hijos en el distrito de Pucará, distrito mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, en dicho distrito la población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de arroz el de mayor producción, así como al comercio en general. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Sebastiana se dedica a la cría y comercio de ganado porcino también a la cría de animales menores como son gallinas, patos, etc. Ella realiza la venta de las crías de su ganado y animales menores lo realiza en su casa y en el puerto de Chiple, dicha actividad lo viene realizando hace más de 06 años, cuenta con un corral amplio para dicha actividad y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio para la compra de un número mayor de animales(patos, conejos, entre otros) para criarlos, engordarlos y después sacarlos a la venta, además también desea invertir en el arreglo de su corral, que es el lugar donde cría a sus animales para de esta forma criarlos en mejores condiciones y así poder adquirir una utilidad acéptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 54 years old, separated and has two dependent children. She lives with her children in the district of Pucará, a medium sized district with aspirations of growing. The people of the district work in agriculture, rice being the main crop and in commerce. This district is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru.

Sebastiana works raising and selling pigs and also raises small animals like chickens, ducks, etc. She sells her pigs and small animals at her house and in the port of Chiple. She has been in this business for more than 6 years. She has a large corral for her business and she has good business and personal references.

The loan will be used to invest in her business . She will buy a large number of animals (ducks, rabbits, amongst others) to raise, fatten and then sell them. She also wants to invest in making improvements to her corral where she raises her animals. Doing this she can raise them in better conditions and thus acquire an acceptable profit to improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater number of animals and to improve the corral where she keeps them.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester runs a business after having worked as a laundrywoman for a daily wage. As a widow from Tudela, Misamis Occidental, she tirelessly supports her family. She is engaged in a snack-vending business selling rice cakes. Her business is doing well since she has perfected her own rice cake recipe. She has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. She requested another loan from PMPC to buy additional raw ingredients for her rice cakes to cater to more customers and be able to accept more orders. She hopes and prays that her business would grow and that she comes up with another snack recipe to increase sales.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for her rice cake business to cater to more customers and enable her to accept orders

loans.name: Anali Stefani

texts.es:
Anali Stefani tiene 18 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y una hija menor de 3 años, vive en casa propia de material rustico de un piso, ella es natural del caserío el roble Sector Mangalpa del distrito Santo Tomas, ella se lleva bien con los miembros de su caserío y pobladores de la zona; vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura; cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Santo Tomas, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Anali Stefani es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1,5 has. Variedad catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación esta en segundo año de producción tiene tres años de edad, cultiva café en caserío el roble, Sector Mangalpa en el distrito Santo Tomas, actividad la realiza hace 3 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café porque toda su familia ha dependido de la agricultura(cultivo de café). Adicionalmente cría ganado vacuno, contando a la fecha con 4 reses de su propiedad, cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros), al cultivo de maíz y también al cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátanos, menestras y otros).

El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 1,5 has. De café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Anali Stefani is 18 years old. She has a stable home alongside her partner and 3 year old daughter. They live in their own, one-floor house made of rustic material. She is a native of el Roble village in the Mangalpa sector in the Santo Tomas district. She gets along well with the members of her village and residents of the area. She lives in a small community dedicated basically to farming. She has good personal and commercial references in the area. Her house has water. This community is located in the district of Santo Tomas, in the province of Cutervo, Cajamarca region, in the northern hills of Peru.

The work that Anali Stefani performs is cultivating coffee. To date, she has 1.5 hectares of the catimor variety resistant to disease. Her plantation is in its second year of production. It is three years old. She farms coffee in El Roble village, in the Mangalpa sector in the district of Santo Tomas. She has performed this work for three years. She has experience in this work cultivating coffee because all of her family has depended on agriculture (planting coffee). Additionally, she also raises cattle. To date, she owns four head of cattle. She raises young animals (hens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others), grows maize and also grows basic crops (yuca, bananas, beans, etc.)

The loan will be used to maintain and cultivate 1.5 hectares of coffee in production, assuring a good production for 2015, reflected in a greater volume of sales and, subsequently, she will obtain greater income to thus improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to maintain and farm 1.5 hectares of coffee assuring a good production for 2015.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, la socia Verónica  continua con su negocio  de restaurante, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua elaborando diferentes tipos de platos como arroz con pollo, saltados entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
A member of the communal bank VELASCO ASTETE, Veronica continues to run her restaurant business. She is a responsible and diligent person. Veronica continues to make a variety of dishes such as chicken with rice and sautees and, in this way, provides for her family.

This member is requesting a loan to buy oil, rice and other things. She is grateful for the loan amount and is committed to complying with its established quotas.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a freezer, an air conditioner, and a generator.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en: Nelsie is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 37, Nelsie, the mother of an infant child, lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She runs a sari-sari (small grocery) store that primarily supports her family. She never get tired tending her store. Nelsie is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without default. Now, she is borrowing another loan to restock items for her sari-sari store to sell and attract more customers. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to restock items for her sari-sari (small grocery) store to attract more customers

loans.name: Ciro Antonio

texts.es:
Ciro, desempeña las actividades de agricultura y ganadería para tener ingresos y costear los diferentes gastos que tiene bajo su responsabilidad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos; aprendió de su padre el oficio de la agricultura, su negocio está funcionando desde hace 23 años, su horario de trabajo es de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, la experiencia que ha adquirido con el paso del tiempo respalda la calidad y preferencia de sus clientes.
Necesita el crédito para comprar abono, fertilizantes e insecticidas, con los que cultivara granos básicos, esperando tener una cosecha abundante para aumentar las ventas y tener mejores ingresos con los que se le hará fácil el cubrir las necesidades de su familia y cancelar su deuda.
Sus aspiraciones son diversificar sus cultivos y aumentar el área de terreno en que los realiza.
texts.en:
Ciro works in agriculture and raises livestock to generate revenue and pay for the various expenses that he is responsible for. He lives with his wife and his two children. He learned agriculture from his father and he has been in the business for 23 years. His work schedule is from 8 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon. The experience he has gained with the passing of time guarantees quality and the preference of his customers.

He needs the loan to buy manure, fertilizer and insecticide to grow his basic grains. He hopes to have an abundant harvest to increase his sales and have higher revenues. That would make it easy to pay for the needs of the family and pay off his loan. His dream is to diversify his crops and increase the amount of land that he cultivates.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Farilia

texts.en:
Farilia is an artisan who has been manufacturing greeting cards and Christmas cards for years. After many years spent in a missionary camp, she opened her gallery in 2011. 

With more craft materials, she would be able to sell a lot more to customers. Therefore, she was referred to Zafen for an opportunity to obtain a loan and find support in coaching the business. Your contribution will help her business grow in the tourist area of Kenscoff.

loans.use: to buy articles and to produce more Christmas cards this year.

loans.name: Wiligobou

texts.fr: Père de 03 enfants tous scolarisés, Wiligobou exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus les portables et ces accessoires à SOKODE. Cette activité qu'il mène lui permet de se prendre en charge et d'assurer le minimum vital à sa famille. Son septième crédit lui servira de approvisionner en grande quantité de marchandise. Wiligobou veut faire accroitre son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. Il a 46ans avec 10ans d'ancienneté.
texts.en:
Willigobou is a father of three; all the children go school.

His business is selling cellphones and cellphone accessories in Sokode. This business allows him to support himself and to provide his family with necessities.

His seventh loan will be used to purchase wholesale merchandise. Willigobou wants to develop his activity and to improve his family's living conditions. He is 46 years old, and has ten years of experience in this business.

loans.use: to purchase cellphones and accessories.

loans.name: Elsa Zenovia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, la socia continua con su negocio de elaboración de tortas para los distintos compromisos que solicitan sus servicios, a la vez la socia continua trabajando para una empresa privada siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como leche, azúcar, mantequilla  entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the communal bank Velasco Astete. She continues with her business of making tortillas on request for a variety of engagements. She also continues working for a private company, this being how she supports her family.

She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies such as milk, sugar, and butter, among others.

She is grateful for the loan opportunity and she is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as milk, sugar, and butter among others.

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Group

texts.en:
Schedule Tribe community in India is the most vulnerable group in India. The people of this community are socially, economically and educationally more backward in comparison to others. 

Tarulata, the featured member of Thakurani Self-Help Group, hails from this community. She is a resident of Pendren village, which is around 150 kilometers from the district headquarters Nuapada of Odisha, India. Tarulata is twenty-four years old and is sitting with a raised hand in the photo. She is a married woman with one daughter. Her husband is a vegetable cultivator. 

The primary work of Tarulata’s family is farming, from which they get a low return, which makes it very difficult to maintain the family. So, she thought about an additional income source and started a milk business to earn some extra income. For the last six years, she has been doing this business. 

Now, she has two cows producing six liters of milk per day. She earns a monthly income of 6,000 INR, which is not sufficient to fulfill her dream. Therefore, she, along with eleven other women of her village, formed the group and availed themselves of a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

From her loan of 12,000 INR, Tarulata will purchase another cow to enhance her milk business, and purchase seeds, fertilizer, etc. for the vegetable cultivation. She is very hopeful that this investment will support her to earn some extra income and help her to save money for better education of her child and construction of a good house.

Out of the other eleven members of the group, six members are vegetable cultivators, four members sell milk, and two members manage a general store.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to enhance her milk business, and purchase seeds, fertilizer, etc. for the vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es: A sus 18 años de edad Gabriela es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 2 años al que ama mucho, comenta que estaba estudiando y desde que tubo a su hijo se salió del colegio, en la actualidad se dedica a cuidar a su niño y   para tener dinero para los gastos de él se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para ponerlos en un pequeño galpón, lo que Gabriela anhela  es mejorar su negocio para tener mas ingresos y velar por el  bienestar de su hijo sobre todo que su hijo este sano de salud.
texts.en:
At 18 years old, Gabriela is a single mother and has a 2-year-old son that she loves very much. Gabriela was in school, and since she had her child she left school. She currently spends her time taking care of her son, and to earn money to cover his expenses she works raising small animals.

She will use the loan to buy chickens and put them in a small barn.  What Gabriela wants most is to improve her business to make more revenues and watch over the well-being of her son. Above all she wants is her son to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 26 años de edad, casada, madre de un niño de 5 años, y su negocio es el tejido de mantas de alpaca.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, trabajadora, paciente y responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad de ‘Batallas’ que se encuentra ubicado en cercanías al lago Titicaca, dónde el clima es muy frío y los rayos del sol muy fuertes.
Maria es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio, su forma de vestir es típica (sombrero, manta y pollera). Su vida la comparte con su marido que se dedica a la agricultura y con su hijo, el cual ya asiste a la escuela. Su negocio es el tejido de mantas de alpaca, ella recorre largas distancias en el altiplano en busca de productores de lana; la compra, la lava, la hilvana y la teje, todo el proceso es manual y tarda mucho tiempo hasta llegar al producto final. Ella sueña mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia obteniendo mejores ingresos con su actividad. Su deseo es realizar la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor
texts.en:
Maria is a 26 year old woman who is married and the mother of one 5 year old son. She has a business knitting alpaca blankets.

She is a business woman, independent, hardworking, patient and responsible. She does her work near Lake Titicaca where the weather is very cold and the rays of sun are very intense.

Maria has a brown complexion and is of medium height with long braided black hair. Her mother tongue is Aymara and she uses Spanish for trade. She dresses traditionally (sombrero, blanket and a full gathered skirt). She shares her life with her husband, who is a farmer, and her son, who already attends school!

Maria’s business is knitting alpaca blankets. She travels long distances in the high country looking for wool producers; she buys it, washes it, bastes it and knits it. The entire process is by hand and it takes some time to produce the final product.

She dreams of improving her family’s quality of life by earning more income from her business. Her desire is to purchase alpaca wool wholesale. Consequently, Maria is requesting a loan in order to purchase alpaca wool wholesale.

loans.use: To buy wholesale alpaca wool to make into beautiful blankets to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa propia, vive en la parte urbana del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú, contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Nelly se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores(patos, cuyes, conejos, entre otros), cuenta con más de 14 años dedicada a este oficio. Y además se dedica a las labores de cocina en el colegio secundario IEMI-PUCARA, ingresos adicionales que le permiten responder al compromiso del préstamo sin problemas.

El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de cerdos, patos y gallinas; para poder aumentar y diversificar su stock de animales, para poder cumplir con todo los gustos y preferencias de su público consumidor. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios, mayores ganancias y por ende una mejora en la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nelly is 40 years old, single, and lives in her own home in the urban part of the district of Pucará, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern Peruvian sierra. Her home is serviced with running water and electricity. Her community mainly works in agriculture, livestock and trade.

Nelly makes a living raising and selling small animals (ducks, guinea pigs, rabbits, and others) and has dedicated more than 14 years to this activity. In addition, she works in the kitchen of the secondary school IEMI-PUCARA, which provides extra income that allows her to respond the the loan commitment without difficulty.

The purpose of the loan will be to invest in the purchase of pigs, ducks and hens, in order to be able to increase and diversify her animal stock and satisfy the tastes and preferences of her consumers. For this activity, there is no great competition in the area, and with this activity she will obtain better prices and greater earnings, and consequently, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of pigs, ducks and hens in order to be able to increase and diversify her stock of animals.
